Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5cSz9kh5a7kTJK7JEtsu0g.text: The Compass Grill; don't get me wrong, this place has an incredible view and a cute cozy date night vibe. However, the food is sub par and the service is comparable.   The last time I went out server was impatient and rude. It seemed like she wanted to get us out as soon as possible to fill the table again. She rushed us in ordering, coming to our table five different times to ask us if we were ready to order, while we were enjoying the view and our bottle of wine.   The food isn't great. Overpriced and just not with it. I had the roasted chicken and it was tasteless and boring.   Probably won't be coming back. This place is a one time stop; go for the view but save your money.

S-9SXPPfUmzJfG0x4Ma8zA.text: As anValley native I was very intrigued to try out the famous rotating restaurant. High end and delicious, the Compass Grill definitely compliments the guests celebrations and offers an amazing view.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xRj-LmziRI7ocPRxmeJM3w.text: Was a beautiful experience, good view of the city and a great staff. The food of the worst, I recommend do not eat there. The food was Dry, no taste and very expensive. But if you want to spend a relaxing time next to your partner, the place is perfect and share your evening with some good drinks.

pcWF2BU8_v582TIA5uxfYA.text: Great view and food! I visit once every couple of months. Food is a little pricey but worth it.

AwowqldUYh-oMbWNdUjH-g.text: Was looking for a restaurant in Phoenix, with a view. Found this place on Yelp. Met up with some friends to catch up recently and was very impressed with the restaurant. Ordered Hennessy on the rocks, and man they fill that bad boy up, only needed that one drink for the evening. That's PLUS! Ordered the Ribeye, with Brussel sprouts, wow! Ribeye was cooked perfect. Medium rare. Brussel sprouts weren't over cooked or burnt, just right, with caramelized onions. My favorite part is that you don't even realize the restaurant is spinning, that you get a 360 degree view of the city. Highly recommend to check out. It's a bit pricey, next time I'll just order the Hennessy on the rocks, with a burger for a cheap night, with a great view.

9l-ZsxEdnCw5LqGbkRyJYg.text: My husband and I came here for our one year anniversary. They bring you bread and cornbread with butter before your meal. It's good. Not the best ever, but good. The crust is hard on the bread, but the middle is warm and soft. Some people don't like the hard outside, but I thought it was okay. I ordered the chicken and my husband ordered the steak. Very, very small portions. He was still hungry so we ordered more bread AND I shared my chicken with him (which was also a very, very small portion) to help fill him up. He did say the streak was DELICIOUS and perfectly tender (his steak was prepared medium), but the portion was much smaller than the size of his fist. The "sides" that they come with are not big either so don't show up starving, unless you plan on getting lots of appetizers before dinner. Overall, decent, but there are lots of restaurants that have better food and bigger portions for much, much less money, but probably not the same view and ambiance.

iuRjOMWeI7DwbbqCJLNfPg.text: Food was mediocre at best.  Service we decent.  Views and experience made it all worth it.

QXuuPglAKbD5EuWWcqZ9Ew.text: The atmosphere is awesome! But I'm not sure the food justifies the price! We went there of our Anniversary and it was a good place for that but not sure I will return.

TbtW680Wsx8eXdNynB5UQQ.text: Good Experience.Food was good and ambience also very good.We are vegetarian and they have good vegetarian option also.

2yWZbZrro9L-jRt-Ri64pg.text: As a kid, I always thought this place spun super fast like an amusement park ride. As a grown-up, I was disappointed to find out it doesn't, but happy to find out there are some great happy hour deals here.  Happy hour is kind of at a weird time (9pm to 11pm), bu it's still one of my favorites. Happy hour features $5 desserts, $5 Canvas Wine (5oz of Chardonnay, Merlot, or Cabernet), $5 Wells, and $7 Featured Signature Cocktails.  I'm not a big fan of dessert, but I have yet to have a dessert here that I didn't like. The Strawberry Shortcake tasted exactly like a Strawberry Good Humor Bar... in other words it was amazing! The Chocolate Tort and Dulce de Leche were also delicious.   Obviously, the view is amazing. It's great to go at sunset, even though there's no happy hour prices. The best part of the amazing view... it distracts from the terribly outdated interior decor. You definitely notice that you're eating in a hotel restaurant.   I've also had some hit/miss experiences with the service. On my first visit, the waiter was nice, but awkward, and brought us the check as soon as he brought us our drinks. If I'm paying over $10 a drink (it wasn't HH yet), at least let me enjoy it before you shove the bill in my face. On another visit, someone in our party told the hostess we just wanted to sit in the bar, and she quickly snapped, "Um, the bar is downstairs. We don't have a bar. Unless you want to sit in the lounge." The "lounge" looked exactly like the rest of the place except with an uglier tables and chairs. If you're going to be snooty, you better have something to be snooty about.  Still, for an amazing view, $5 wines, and $5 desserts, there's no place better than the Compass Room.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate tort &amp; dulche de leche ice cream

Gy146PFZ7oYWHrwVuN0fwQ.text: The food was excellent and so was the service. I was going to a basketball game went there for dinner will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bFx1zXN_afNXjx9aam36hw.text: Really bland, unseasoned, and tasteless food. The view is great but not worth the money.

Z6Vpo2Bam4ac3UzwD23WLA.text: Jacob is amazing. Service is professional; food is exquisite...and the view speaks for itself! Absolutely one of our favorite places to dine.

__td18hvbts6X36oo2toAg.text: This is such a beautiful restaurant, if you're going to spend your money some where this place won't disappoint! Also the menu is seasonal so there are always unique new options.

42sIGaRAjC2yzwzFAlU_sw.text: The restaurant is famous for its 360 degree view of the city skyline and if you're fond of Arizona sunsets this is the place to be. However when it came to the food, I was highly disappointed. We were there to celebrate  our anniversary with our 2 year old. My husband ordered the roasted chicken entree and I went for the south western ceased salad. Both of the dishes were sad and disappointing in taste, chicken was too dry abc over cooked. We had ordered chicken fingers and fries for our son and they somehow mixed up the order and got something totally different (grilled chicken and veggies) where chicken was again over cooked and dry. I had to ask extra dressing for my salad as it was just plain lettuce and Parmesan cheese. Overall the food experience was unpleasant but the service was good. They offered us completely dessert, I had lost my appetite till then.  Overall a very costly affair just to enjoy the view and sunset. Food totally not worth it.

dxPONmTuj83lszhuGwp6qw.text: This place is great if you are looking for a nice view and different dining experience with the rotating floor. But the food itself is not the best. Overpriced food, overall the food was just ok kind of bland. We tried the ribeye, tamales, ceviche, pork chop, and chipotle short ribs. Nothing was "bad" but not something I need to try again.

7lphxRexUv2nZo6ujFP_vA.text: Awesome revolving restaurant on top of the Hyatt with Beautiful views! Excellent service and great choices on the menu. The food was superb. We hope to visit again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Watching a dust storm coming in!

hscaz6M6iTIi0zy86RXFlw.text: I've only been once, but it was a very nice night. The food was great, very flavorful. The drinks were good, and the whole revolving restaurant experience made it even more interesting. We lucked out that the D-backs won a game that night, so we got the best view of the fireworks that I think you could get. Only downsides, it can be hard to find a good parking spot nearby, and it is not a good place to go if you are afraid of heights.

S7_RK7rvKRFQLL3fccVCnQ.text: The following is an email I sent to Compass last week, they never even bothered to respond. To: erica.owen@hyatt.com Mar 22 at 12:32 PM Erica, Not sure this should go to you or if not, please forward to the appropriate person. Last night (7:00 pm reservation for Jim Deem, party of 4), we came to your establishment to show our visitors from Utah the City, and to have an excellent meal. While the view was great, the meal was not so much. My wife had the Braised short ribs - found a huge piece of fat in the meat, very unappetizing, while the rest of the flavor was fine. What was not good was when we went home - she spent the bulk of the night on the toilet. I had the small filet and again the flavor and the house sauce was great, but as soon as I got home it was a fight for the bathroom. Our other two guests had no complaints. The other thing I'm sure you know is that it was so noisy, it was difficult to have conversation. I share all of this with the hope that you will check it out and help insure that others don't have the experience that we had. You are welcome to contact me if you wish further info. I will not go back, nor will I encourage others to go there!!!

nz27LM_03WEL-GdPzUcHDA.text: Every since I was little I always remember seeing that round spaceship looking restaurant on top of the downtown Hyatt Regency but I have never been. Perfect way to have celebrated my anniversary! The staff was fantastic, it took a little bit to have someone at our table so I was a little nervous but soon enough our server came very apologetically so all was well. It had a modern warm interior and our table in their kind of sunken area around the windows was VERY comfortable. Fantastic cocktails from their lounge (we took a ride share, don't drink and drive!) APPETIZERS! Calamari was delicious cooked with peppers and served with an aioli sauce and a strawberry jalapeno sauce looked like a jam to me and I don't like Jams so I didn't try it, my partner said it complimented the peppers on the calamari very well. We debated on a second entree but decided on another cocktail instead (a liquid appetizer) ENTREE my partner had the 16oz ribeye he said he could have used it a little more pink for mid rare but loved it. My 6oz filet was great and cooked perfectly, melted in my mouth. Bacon and brie Mac and cheese am I dreaming? Very rich but incredibly savory. Mexican street corn with paprika and lime cream very good! Let's be sure to address the best part of compass THE VIEW! Incredible view of the valley luckily we came on a weekend to avoid that lovely brown smog that lingers over our city. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great views
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diamondbacks
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunset

FR-T7vOkYlANSRJhuT4CFg.text: This is a rotating restaurant! We didn't order any food here, but just came for the late night happy hour. I got the whiskey ginger (one of the more popular drinks in grad school), and was actually surprised to hear that they had ginger beer. The views were great, the ambience of candles and city lights. It felt like a completely different atmosphere from our hotel room just a few floors below, stepping out of those elevator doors and feeling like Cinderella being escorted across the red carpet

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A whiskey ginger with a view

aJAZsW8xEJR-RFHh-1TrSg.text: What an amazing place. Obviously great views, but a fantastic menu as well. We only stayed for drinks and dessert but I hope to be back for sunset dinner again. Our drinks were both delicious and the dessert was "worth it". Hopefully you know by now that this restaurant spins (slowly) atop the Hyatt Regency in downtown Phoenix. But until you experience it, you won't get just how beautiful it really is. Also, the window side chairs and sofas are extremely comfortable. We had a great time!

2WLMviIkvpwEZSE5mZsLzA.text: One of the most amazing dining experiences of my life! We were seated right before sunset, and while the sun occasionally was in our eyes, the slowly rotating 360 view of Phoenix was incomparable. We ordered the pork chop which was pure culinary bliss! I have never tasted anything that good and I hope to one day try again! Can't wait to return!

EzI03JYStReu2sPDXGS7Gw.text: 3 stars for the experience that was about it. Food is so subpar it's ridiculous. Calamari was limp, lobster bisque was bland, the scallop risotto was so smoky and definitely not cooked enough.   Service was good though!

IIHhvwwgj9rYfUyfVZc5uQ.text: We wanted to check out the revolving restaurant here. Made dinner reservations for 7:30 PM and were seated promptly. The views are really pretty! We just missed the sunset, but the view was still very nice - filled with the skyline and lights. It was a bit chilly while eating there, so definitely bring something to cover up!   For drinks, we ordered the William Hill cab (I thoroughly enjoyed this) and the sparking raz. For an appetizer, we ordered the calamari, which was a little underwhelming as it wasn't served with the normal aioli or cocktail sauce and the portion. I would say pass on ordering this appetizer. For entrees, we ordered the shrimp capellini pasta and the ribeye off of the summer menu with the additions of creamed corn and the pork-braised greens. The ribeye was pretty disappointing - it was cooked medium rare but still tough. One thing I do know is that you must order the pork-braised greens. I think that was honestly the highlight of the food selections.   Overall, the service was very friendly but the food was a little disappointing especially for the price point. The rotating restaurant concept was pretty cool, but I'd definitely only come back for drinks and the view.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ribeye (front) and shrimp capellini (back)

G4Cuphyqs1FAI8de5VCefg.text: We had a bit of challenge in getting a reservation on a Saturday night. When I called, I was told there were no available tables. Then I tried making an on-line reservation: Success!   The Compass Arizona Grill, like the Hyatt, is somewhat retro. Do they even build revolving restaurants anymore? It really seems like something from the 60s or 70s.   Not sure it is something I would want to do every Saturday night. But it was a good way to relax after a day of traveling. We had more than a full revolution and had a good view of downtown Phoenix -- plus the sunset.  We began our meal with a bottle of cabernet sauvignon and a bread basket which featured two seeded buns and three mini loaves of cornbread. Butter and honey butter were good complements. DH thoroughly enjoyed his entree: three small beef medallions with a side of roasted brussels sprouts. I ordered one of the specials: a Moroccan dish with couscous and peppers, topped with mahi mahi. Sounded intriguing. The portion of fish was quite large -- I had to push myself to finish it. For me, chicken or lamb would have been a better choice than the fish. The couscous was a bit on the cool side and didn't have much of a "zip" to it -- needed more spices.  We ended our meal with a delicious cherry tart served with vanilla ice cream. It was quite lovely ... not too tart, not too sweet. The generous portion was perfect for sharing.  Jacob was our server ... helpful, yet not overly intrusive. All in all Compass Arizona Grill was a good option. Worth trying at least once when in Phoenix.

_J7bWkq78AQrEEs7UmycvA.text: Exceptional costumer service from Maria, I would give her 6 star if I could. We came there for a desert to have our gender reveal for our new born, she was really nice and made our day really special, she went the extra mile on everything to really make it a special day for us.

Phw-Sv4wvWO5kAkZkBVK3w.text: The view of course was great and the rotating room went around one and a quarter times in the hour and a half of dining. The food overall was very disappointing. The cornbread was sweet and tasty but the chicken and risotto both had odd flavors. The chicken had some dill tasting flavor and the chorizo tasted more like a hotdog. My wife got a decent steak

0h7liNVSwwGjDDWsD47sKg.text: Fun experience!  The food isn't as great for the price, but the experience and service was fun. It would be great for a special occasion or prom night dinner.

Y4tSegLd8IlFUac5mn7xDg.text: Beautiful view of downtown Phoenix ...the service was very good...the food and price was great

kZkH_QEO3lQI25fxmDUqQg.text: You pay for the view and that's about it.  The food is average, yet very expensive ($270 including tip for three adults).  $44 petit filet was ok, and at that price it should be on par with Durants.  The service was very good, friendly, competent.  Views are spectacular and the experience itself is worth the price.  The ambiance within the restaurant is very, very outdated. Looks like an upscale Dennys. Time for a remodel, Compass Grill!

2Y3sa8A4zdjpr2UhzDszrA.text: Amazing dinner. More variety on the menu wouldn't hurt though.

wq0fm4d7PeSjzQjgGB24AQ.text: This place is a fun experience.  To be clear, you don't go there for the food....you go for the experience.  The view is outstanding.  We've been going every year or two for many years to see the entire central city, sunsets, incoming airplanes, and lightning storms in the distance.  We watched both gigantic sports stadiums being built below us and have even caught a local haboob (giant dust storm)  boiling up from the south.  Little kids could go if they are really well-behaved (it's a quiet setting), and teens will think it's cool.  Grandparents and great-grandparents love it!  While slightly spendy, this experience is fun for all ages.  Life is short....find the silver linings....the Compass Room is a fun restaurant!!

BYbQ7QFzyGDMUCU2tZguVA.text: The scenery from this restaurant is fantastic I would definitely go there for the view they serve anything from hamburgers to fillet. The dinners we had were good pot roast excellent ,beef tips good and  as many restaurants serve the vegetables -raw - not really cooked.Dress code was for men from suits to shorts and females in gowns to shorts

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef tips
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pot roast

puPMNj8A-QsgZf5aomvnyQ.text: If you come here, I would probably suggest only coming if you plan on getting one of their more pricey items like a steak. Otherwise, go elsewhere for a burger. My girlfriend and I are simple foodies, but wanted to come more the experience itself. My burger smelled funny and didn't really hit the spot for $20. But like I said I'm more into just simple food. What breaks it for me was the service. Waitress came to the table and said nothing. And then couldn't politely answer my question about beverages because they are no where on the menu, and then came later to take our order and then went off on a seafood dish out of nowhere. Also, I made reservations a day before and got there and still had to wait. How does that make sense?

gMN0jfO4iBWY6hbXKKd8kA.text: Over rated. I'm gluten free for medical reasons. Those reasons being I get food poisoning like symptoms when I consume too much gluten.   I ordered the Fondue appetizer and asked for veggies to go with it as a substitution. I don't think my waitress understood this. Which caused me to have to remind her AGAIN when the appetizer came out.   There were only a handful of meal options, so I went with a salad which had delicious candied almonds. It is sad when that is the highlight of a meal.   The service was horrible. We had an appetizer, two well drinks, two salads and our bill was almost $70.   The worst part of the experience is that I have been sick for 12 hours after leaving there. If you have a gluten issue I would highly recommend not going to this place.

ONRczmFBuilOlgC7FxiVlg.text: The views were beautiful, the atmosphere nice; however, the food and drinks did not meet expectations.

86iFvTk3tp-MTnAHaCiEwA.text: The view was awesome! The waiters were really nice and helpful. The food was ok, my had salmon and I had the filet.

-Sx7LeaWzEyRnj8UVi65KQ.text: Fantastic view of the city. Great service and really good food. Great place for a date

4X6lqVW8H3JBDaJYGftEMg.text: Second time here and we had an outstanding evening. Food was wonderful and service was amazing. Anthony was a great waiter.

bF8PxAA89EcYTDZYJY4PEA.text: Views are spectacular!  The restaurant experience including the elevator, cleanliness, and ambience is all first class.   Service was good, not outstanding.  The bone in ribeye and scallops were delicious! The pricing is high for the food quality and menu choices but added with the view makes it more tolerable.

7nwlVRio63yC7gUpVifxYg.text: Great Experience!  My company had a party of 16 and I couldn't of been more pleased with the service.  All the food came out together seamlessly.  The beverages were quick and always full.  Not once did I ever turn around looking for staff.  Thank you for a great night!

VPVHP5XvGssmHXoZbL5xXA.text: The view and service were great. I ordered the steak medallions with mashed potatoes. They were good, I just wasn't a huge fan of the sweet sauce on it. overall, great experience.

_xkVGthM2Jlv2cTEdpQmYA.text: I am in love with this place. It's great for special occasions and I would recommend it for couples especially. The atmosphere is very romantic. I got the filet mignon and the suggested red wine. My boyfriend got the pork chop with white cheddar grits. And because it was our anniversary we shared the creme brulee. The restaurant turns a full rotation every 30 minutes or so. It's slow enough not to make you feel sick and fast enough to see the view of Phoenix perfectly. Sunset is a must. We left there feeling like we were walking out of a dream. This place is my favorite place in Arizona right now. Be prepared to pay for the experience. But it's well worth it. And the service is amazing as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pork chop!
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The filet mignon!

O7uhDiaQb8yiPjUjmiuUTg.text: Big Time Jerseys employees had a great time celebrating our recent accomplishments at Compass Arizona Grill.  Making reservations was easy. Our table was ready for us when we arrived.  The food was fantastic.  Beautifully presented and absolutely wonderful tastes.  The service was great!  Our team really enjoyed the fun, the views and the food.  Thank you!

XFlm5Bb05drcLeIHKl7dkg.text: Good food, great view, fantastic service. The revolving view is reason enough to go. An awesome place especially for out towners.

Y46W3KEBr8Hhdub6vX8L7A.text: Enjoyed the revolving view and excellent food. Hubby had a steak and I had AZ Surf and Turf burger. Mac and cheese was tasty. Wine good too! Would recommend for romance or out of town guests.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet wine is my friend

FNTMEf9M_ci4noge3MzjRQ.text: I debated between 3 and 4 stars but settled on 4. The reason I was hesitant is because it's a little overpriced for the food quality and selection but in the end you are paying a bit for the view and the experience.   The food was good, but nothing was great, and the portions are small.  I shared a calamari appetizer, had the salmon, and we shared a dessert and I still wasn't full when we left. I even had a few of their amazing cornbread concoctions.   Good but not great, I would recommend going once for a special occasion to see if you like it. We made a reservation about 30 min before sunset so the views were great and we got to watch the sunset. Once the sun goes down, the views aren't nearly as worth it.

SqCmtvLNpbeEcnAx8JkB4A.text: Came for our 5th anniversary. This place is lovely! The staff is friendly and the service is great. The salmon was amazing!!! I would love to come here again. Dress up. This is not a jeans and t-shirt kind of place. Sunset is a beautiful time to come. The restaurant makes a full rotation in an hour so you get to see the whole view from the top of the building. What an amazing idea!

iM7qFeDvT4HzXfsEMY2UJA.text: BAD and SLOW service! Food was ok, we expected food to be good due to the cost. The only thing good about this restaurant is the view. We got there at 7:30 pm and was out at 9:45 pm.   Salty corn bread, no wine cork service, calamari was fake and chewy, steak was ok.

EFzBKu6C5wZZVl0Z0bbdHg.text: The view was great, food and service were not. I think because we had a party over 6 and 18% gratuity was already included our server really acted like he gave a rats ass about us. I mean completely ignored us on several occasions and seemed irritated one of the members of our party was late and then was pissy and acted like we were a waste of his time the rest of the meal. Took an excruciating long time to get our food. Pork belly tostadas were good because its bacon, but the bacon was overcooked and were more like bacon croutons on two itty bitty tacos. Our medium rare steaks  ended up being medium well and needed more seasoning. Brussel sprouts were not fully cooked but must have been put in the broiler as the inside was raw and the outside burned. Save your money and take a night hike for a nice view.

Hg0bOB0F_mp3SlQxlrsKSg.text: The two stars was for the view which was amazing, the food however was not even diner level. 1 (literally 1) crab cake that was decent not bad and $20 , I ordered a bees knees drink and im pretty sure it was lemon juice and gin. Service was pretty bad and  I would expect it way better when we had two servers  If you want to go for maybe a glass of wine and not to eat but only look at the view would recommend

9Wj77m98o_sTxbPsiv8C0A.text: Nice staff, great views of the city and a cool and original ambience makes this a great date spot. Food was decent but lacked flavor and originality, and the cocktails were a bit small for the price. Overall you are paying for the 360 degree views from the rotating restaurant, which is a cool deal but more than likely not a place I'd visit more than once.

lnyH9Kj913zdpbEi0wpQKA.text: I made a reservations for my 11 anniversary. They said they would give us a special desert if we purchased a desert and they said they would tell the server it was our anniversary. We got to the restaurant they seated everyone before us. Said nothing about our anniversary and never gave us the special desert for ordering a desert. I also ordered short ribs and it was more like pot roast with sauce in it. I will never go back to this place!!!! I paid $150 for bad food and nothing's special. Horrible place. No stars wasn't an option!

-uXVGn_36qFouM9mDl7MVw.text: The views and service were top notch and exceeded my expectations.  As far as the food is concerned I would not recommend Compass Arizona Grill because it was bland and there were deserts that even the waiter wouldn't recommend.  For that price point we expected a higher level of food but the views, service and a special night made it worth it.

njrciYQDEMn4IzJFyW3msw.text: We went to this restaurant to celebrate his birthday.  The ambiance was nice.  There are small postings about the city that give fun facts as the restaurant turns.  The service was efficient and friendly.  Our waitress even offered a complimentary dessert, but we were too full.  We are huge Chef Ramsey fans so we use a rating scale based on his shows for our reviews: 5 Stars - Ramsey, 4 Stars - Master Chef, 3 Stars - Black Jacket, 2 Stars - Sous Chef, 1 Stars - F Off!  The Corn bread (Ramsey) was awesome.  I think we ate too much which is why we couldn't eat dessert.  Crab cake (Black Jacket) good but we've had better, Macaroni & Cheese (Master Chef) great, Filet Mignon (Sous Chef) we ordered medium and it was overcooked, and Mashed Potatoes (F off) were horrible.  Overall we enjoyed an nice date out with decent food.

hfCUr3cKYoV7ZQxXHwGJqw.text: Given the situation I had high standards going into the place. The food was good but our server was not up to par on her knowledge of the drink menu in my opinion. She was sweet and kind but at that level I feel you need more than that. The server assistant was great and on top of things. I want to give this place another try because I felt it had the potential to be an a better experience.

BRc4Gr1Jf5UnLDEX5iKUvA.text: I ate dinner here a few weeks ago. Perfect place to be able to see the whole city. The food was some of the best I had. The cantaloupe and watermelon bruschetta had such a unique flavor. I loved it. I got the cucumber mojito which I highly recommend.  It is a bit pricey but worth every cent!

2f8qdTW-aV4dhzxzV14k9w.text: I took my husband here tonight for his birthday and I must say, we were not disappointed. The view was spectacular, the food was fantastic. We thoroughly enjoyed our evening and experience as this was our first time dining here. All of the staff were very nice and friendly. I had filet mignon and it was seasoned very well, he had the scallops and loved it. We also had dessert. Now he got the gelato, super yummy and I had the apple cobbler. I have had a lot of apple pie, apple cobbler, ok, I've had a lot of apple desserts and can I just say this was really good but the one thing that I didn't like and it kind of ruined it for me is they leave the peeling on the apple. In my opinion the cobbler would have been perfection if they peeled the apples before making the cobbler. Other than that we enjoyed the food and view of the city. Thank you for a memorable evening.

U4DhLaN6xpLH1wvKTp3gAA.text: Beautiful sky restaurant with mediocre food.   On the 24th floor of the Hyatt, Compass is the perfect restaurant for date night. The dining area rotates - one full rotation takes one hour - giving you a 360 view of Downtown Phoenix.   Between two, we shared the roasted beet caprese, house spring salad, pork belly tostada, lobster bisque, and the red snapper special. The flavors of everything, except the pork belly were a little off.   Burrata sat at the center of the plate, topped with arugula, roasted beets, and with what I think was supposed to be an olive oil drizzle, but was more of a pool. Beet caprese was an oily, mushy, glob of confusion. The lobster bisque was a bowl of extra watery fishyness. And for the red snapper special, it was literally a piece of flavorless grilled fish.   I gotta say though, the pork belly was pretty good. Pork belly was braised, cooked well, and had a nice bold, spiced onion taste.   If you're looking for a romantic date night with the views, this is the spot, but don't expect anything from the food.

pZKG1VXHbiuGxtZ_vUCkUQ.text: Went here for happy hour. Got beautiful views of the city and really good drink prices!

-HqFq8x6T2WshdaDKkqOrQ.text: The staff was great, they always made sure we were doing okay with out being too pushy like most places. Lindsey our server was fantastic. When I wasn't sure what I wanted she gave great recommendations. I go to a lot of restaurants and this was by far one of the best ones I've been to, and Lindsey was one of the sweetest, most attentive waitress I have experienced. I would definitely come back not only for the 360 view but for the service and food and drinks. You will not be disappointed in coming to experience this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w7u7mlTBUDUxOlicRaVksg.text: Great experience! Pros: the view obviously, the food, the service. Cons: if the hotel is busy, it takes forever to get up to the 24th floor. Wine selection is ummm Wal-Mart wines at x6 prices. I was disappointed with their limited selections, I just expected more from a place like this.   Price: slightly more than what you'd expect. More than mastros. Food: appearance is fancy AF, taste is yummy but nothing to dream about later. Brie appetizer was great, dessert was both interesting and delicious. We got the creme brulee very sweet but worth it.  Service: you get a server and a helper.  All very attentive.  People: a mix of dressed up love birds having a romantic dinner and very casual hotel guests who want to party cause they're on vacation. You can wear whatever you want which again makes the tab seem over priced at the end there.   I would take guests here but I probably won't be celebrating another anniversary or birthday here.

BTNBYkUkUqxuK0vE3tGaYg.text: Food looked like slop, the room was hot and the waitress was absent...kudos to the woman telling my water, hardest working person in the joint. Dirty windows and flecks of something all over my napkin. It gets 2 stars for the novelty.

iYyCr9Nc5Y1kDASWDeQQxQ.text: Amazing views, food and service! The calamari appetizer is to die for, definitely a must have.

Zsmt-3n0o7enyXAkoFle6w.text: "Stupid amazing" is what my hubby says. We read mixed reviews and didn't have high expectations but were completely blown away. Our steaks were "melt in your mouth" - literally - the most tender steaks we've ever had. We both cut ours with our forks! We haven't even had dessert yet and I'm posting this. He got the bacon Brie Mac and cheese and - OH. MY. GAWD!!! Just amazing!  We made reservations for 8 so we could see the city at night and that was totally worth it! What a view! Takes and hour and a half to make a full rotation.

QFn5ZRUjfmYrex4LuiDh1A.text: Wonderful food. Great filets. The service is great. Very nice people. Beautiful views and great ambiance.

reyleQIhCV3eDE0sRw8lvQ.text: I was skeptical at first about an elegant/nice steak house being in the same conversation as hotel food, but dang! I am not a steak expert, but I am a steak lover and I had the best steak of my life here (the filet mignon). If you are visiting Phoenix, this is a MUST! The high-rise revolving restaurant gives you a 360 view of the city and beyond (pictures attached, but they don't do it justice at all). The corn bread and honey butter is mouth watering. All around fantastic experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dMLCf7PC9whfgQ9rpin20Q.text: Dined tonight, 11-14-17, which is a Tuesday. To start with I'd give the flexibility of the server 5 stars, but this experience left much to be desired. Me and my coworkers are staying at the Hyatt, and wanted to have a nice meal together while we are here on training and away from our multi state homes. We chose this restaurant as it's in the hotel, it's 24th floor in downtown Phoenix and I think over 1 hour you can see the whole city.   The pricing is up there, and looks wise it's nice looking, but it's not super fancy either. Being a large group and all needing separate checks, the server was flexible about this, so again 5 stars. It's also in his best interest because it's automatic 18% gratuity if you are a party of 6 or more, and with the price being higher, our table alone was almost $100 in tips, so I can't add stars to this experience, plus it was a Tuesday and not super busy either.   Tonight some of coworkers didn't arrive by 6:45PM, so we decided to go ahead and get our orders in, as we were all hungry. I ordered a 1LB Rib Eye which comes with 1 side ($9 ea - ala carte) for $50.  Our food took a VERY LONG TIME to come out, they were 8 of us, I ordered mine rare it came out a perfect rare. 2 other people ordered steaks and both of there's was overcooked. The flavor of the steak was okay, besides being cooked a perfect rare, nothing exciting about the taste.   Where the big failure for me was the brussel sprouts. He asked if I like them charred, which I said I did. There were charred but with a super sweet demi glaze sauce, they were so coated and gross, I couldn't only get down a couple. If you like brussel this is like a kid version that might appeal to child's taste buds, but not if your an adult who actually likes them! As Gordon Ramsay would say, "I would not feed them to my DOG!" They were cooked terribly too, boiled, and charred sweet saucy black messes. Overall, for these kind of prices, this food was a TOTAL  it's a total fail, I would give 1 star if the server wasn't flexible and nice.    So this restaurant rotates, and I quickly got seasick, it's sound really cool, but I hated dining there. I was dizzy and just uncomfortable often watching everything move just enough that you had to trick your brain to not see it, then you would again, I even put my back to the view within 1 minute of looking out, which obviously didn't help. If you want a view, just get a room on the top floor of the Hyatt, order to go, and dine in the room!   Getting checked out was a long process and I do give credit to the flexibility of the server, but it was 1-2 checks at time, just not great process. I was dizzy and just wanted to leave. I left about 8:45PM so this was a 2 hour dining experience from ordering. I would never dine here again. The only good news is our company will reimburse the meal + 18% gratuity, THANKFULLY!

DKa6UYadVFLTfBwAX54FGQ.text: the Compass has a unique experience. the rotating dining area lets you view Downtown like you've never seen it before and sometimes you didn't even notice you were moving. making reservations was very easy through their online website. the whole 24th floor was very clean and classy. the hostess and servers were very friendly and prompt.   the drinks and food were made perfectly. i ordered a cocktail and an 8oz steak, presentation and flavor were all there. i would definitely recommend anyone who wants to dine here to make reservations for around sun set. you'll be able to experience the view from daylight to night life.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and Asparagus.

dKDkTXO_eihZBf-hM3zUtQ.text: The view was beautiful & i enjoyed that, food was okay, but too much sauce on our appetizer & on our main course. I would recommend asking it for on the side. Drinks took awhile to get but food was quick. Service was not the best, but she got us what we needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The apples with the cheesecake was a great combo. The churro was good but wish there was more.
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb was great &amp; the filet mignon was delicious but too much sauce.
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread was delicious!

9VUJmh1fxuYLUp5Se25TEw.text: Went to the compass room after the symphony, for dessert. Dessert was pretty good we had the custard trio- chocolate, honey, and vanilla. We had a drink each, service was great, and the view was nice. Dessert was $6, drinks ranged from $8-12.

ITsEDPTtJNd96RjhJPbBoQ.text: View was great...appetizers too, dinner was terrible. Cold potatoe's no matter how you ordered them.....steak overcooked, burnt to charcoal on the outside, lobster tails were cold. Free range chicken, one leg, one breast. Leg undercooked, breast over cooked....had hoped for a moist roasted chicken and received a tomato pasted one. Tried this place over 20 years ago and it was great....this past weekend after a long drive from San Diego.....I must say $300.00 later I feel taken to the cleaners. If you want to experience the rotating part with the view...order a drink and an appetizer and skip dinner.

EHqMc_DxAE5oiQjpla0BGw.text: I would give this place 3.5 stars.  The service was excellent and the view of Pheonix at sunset was nice.  I ate the wedge salad (nothing special) and the chorizo mac and cheese (yummy).  The highlight for me was the pudding trio, the honey date flan was delicious but the portion was small...which led me to savor every bite.  The other people in my party were satisfied with their food and there were no complaints.

bW8VKyIJtjYRuqkXgZHixw.text: I thought I'd give this place a second try, due to some friends who were visiting and absolutely love dining there. The view is breathtaking, however, the food is not as amazing. I had the salmon with kale. It was quite bland for my taste. I've had the steak before and it was a much better choice. I'd recommend this restaurant  for a special occasion and if you've never been there before. We went on a Friday night, it's low key and a "tame"environment. Definitely not for those who are looking for a more vivacious atmosphere.

V-9Aj6inbLRl6VvIiUMf7w.text: Romantic!!!! Fabulous service! Great cocktails! Dreamy Ambiance!  Awesome food!

nXfrNwkxXJrJ6rj5zG5dbg.text: We had a great time at the compass grill. I had one of their specialty cocktails, wish I could remember the name but it was one of the bourbon drinks. It was superb! The small garden salad was terrific. I let the server know about my dairy and egg sensitivities, she helped me navigate the menu. I ended up with the salmon and brussel sprouts. The sprouts were the best I have ever had. Wish we had time to stay for dessert, but we were headed across the street to a concert. The only draw back was the time it took to get the food. The server mentioned we should order quickly since the restaurant was getting really busy. We did, but it still took a while. We got there at 5:45 and didn't get out until after 7. Can't wait to go back again one day, I'll add a little more buffer for time next time. The views are great. The sun can be intense but it moves along quickly enough that you aren't in it for too long. I recommend this!

D3zkR_-s_4DyN5OsSIONCg.text: I was looking for either steak or seafood and as I'm staying in the hyatt I gave it a shot, despite some of the less than complimentary reviews. Well, I'm glad I did. I was undecided between steak or the sea bass and my server suggested the sea bass. What an excellent choice! It was wonderful. Cooked perfectly with excellent flavor. I accompanied this with a Michael Mondavi chardonnay which complimented the meal well. Why 4 and not 5? Wine list and spirit offerings could be a lot better. Very limited to basic spirits and the wines could vary a bit more. Otherwise this restaurant is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Views from the restaurant.

G5AsBafzfCUl_zC_m4KQoA.text: I've wanted to go here since I was young and we finally made reservations and went.    The view was great except the windows were pretty dirty.  The service was nice and when we first got there it was early enough it was still pretty empty.  Our first issue was that the item we wanted to order that we had seen on the web site menu wasn't available.  My girlfriend ordered one of the only other vegetarian items and it ended up being nothing as described.  It's first ingredient was eggplant but it only had a very paper thin layer of eggplant on the top.    The food was OK at the time, but both my girlfriend and I were pretty sick within an hour or two of eating there.  We would have given two stars but the endless bread was good and they got an extra star for that.

2jpNOpmFZuJlEHKk7SNw1A.text: Very disappointed. Drove down from Las Vegas for a birthday celebration and the service we received while dining here was very disappointing. Our waitress was very slow, non approachable, and there were two other couples that complained about their service as well. We asked for our steak medium and it came out 40 minutes later and was medium well done. The atmosphere was the highlight of the evening as it revolves 360 around Phoenix. There is also a 15 Valet fee you have to pay. We paid 85 for a steak, vegetables, and mashed potatoes. My salad wasn't very tasty so skipped out on that.

WYPbcxKMS7VtHsY8eoae0Q.text: My girlfriend and I went here for our six month dating anniversary! The views were amazing! And the food was very good! Our server, Jacob, was very attentive and took great care of us. Overall an amazing experience at Compass!

FJyyCQ0sBnn4UiLHsAEipA.text: The view was spectacular!  We had tip to get a table on the outside even though the restaurant was not full. The food was fair. My niece and I had the filet. My husband the tips and my nephew the rib eye. My filet was very thin and over cooked. No salad was included. One side was. Mashed we're ok. Mac and blu was crunchy. The dessert was the best part. Gelato and the chocolate flourless cake. We requested a candle ( we were celebrating a big birthday), regrettably they did not accommodate. The bill for 4 and 2 glasses of prosecco was over 3 bills. Would not recommend for dinner. Too expensive for quality of food. Have just a drink instead.

GSnZS1Sn0uraBNBSQTjpCA.text: The views and food are great! Service and desert could be better though. Nothing was bad about the service but we were never offered a wine list or asked for a drink order. This seems like a huge miss on the restaurants part. The black and white cake was dry with no flavor so we took one bite and left. This is rare for us not to finish anything sweet. We were the only people in the place since it opened early for the final four. Could not reserve on open table but did on yelp and it would only let us do 5:30 even though a hotel manager told us it would open at 5. I went to the hotel concierge to update our time but was told I would have to call once they opened because the concierge can not make reservations at the restaurant in the hotel. He also was not aware it was opening early. If I was a concierge I would call myself or use yelp myself for the customer if the hotel did not empower me to help a guest. Mind you he was not at valet or doing anything else. the elevator also did not work at 5pm so we had to get engineering to help us get up to the restaurant. seems like the hotel does not have good communication or customer service so just keep that in mind if you want to check this place out.

Z8Z4If7PmDqXMuv3zWkREQ.text: It was amazing service , I proposed to my gf here now fiance ! The hosts worked with me through out the whole experience ! Food and drinks and view was spectacular ! Thank you compass grill

tUDyLklIrbLHGcjerRN7fQ.text: Would have given them 5-stars (wonderful food and amazing views of the Valley) but we were seated next to a large and very loud group which didn't make for a very romantic experience. We explained to the hostess (and in our reservation) that my husband and I were there for our 1-year wedding anniversary. I thought that they could have placed us somewhere quieter, especially since they were barely half full upon arrival.

p15i96IKpIZlS_poWZOXjA.text: The views were spectacular, drinks were fantastic. Don't expect stellar service, however. We were told we couldn't wait in the lounge due to others waiting for those seats. By the time we were seated no one had sat in the lounge. At one point I was given a gesture by our server that felt like a "wait your turn" when I was trying to get her attention.  We were always flagging people down for things like the bill or salt. Yes salt-the Brussel sprouts and mushroom bolognese were underseasoned.   I would go back again for the amazing sunset, but that's about all.

n5asJ1tH9jT_YkfklhORFg.text: So, I  guess if it's a view you are looking for, then this is definitely the place, however, if it's great food you want, then I can guarantee that this is NOT the place.  My lobster bisque had hardened on top so that when you put your spoon in, the top layer actually wrinkled into the soup. My friend's shrimp was overcooked and chewy/tough. We had reservations and still had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. Overall, I can think of other restaurants that can give you great food & dining experience together. My suggestion is if you want both, then skip this place entirely.

twWsuuyl21f__Y81dEpoiQ.text: I would say i had the best time in Arizona in terms of the quality of time that i had spent with my wife. It was her birth day and we almost spent like close to 2 hours and enjoying the delicious food. Service was good.. We were greeted in the starting also my wife was happy as she got wish from the host for the birthday wishes. Overall i would say must go place.

vgZeo9HPjSpd8EObGleGNA.text: This is the coolest, most romantic, delicious, amazing restaurant I've ever been to. I'm glad I could take my boyfriend:)

XVAbWcEf7jXTLKW8nwmgxA.text: We had received a gift card, so we decided to get appetizers and drinks before hitting a movie. It was really neat and we quite enjoyed ourselves.  We only had to wait about five minutes for a table and we got to enjoy the view as we waited. It is on the 24th floor of the Hyatt and rotates slowly, giving you an excellent view of the entire Phoenix metropolitan area. Their prices were not as bad as we were expecting, it averaged what any other bar is in the downtown area. Their Prickly Pear Margarita was quite delicious. Their calamari was not very flavorful, and I was not a big fan of the cheescake, but for cocktails, this is a great spot!

95R3IukmYLEWNN2XGzN3Eg.text: Beautiful views....wonderful service...limited menu though....would have enjoyed more choices...

uAGM-Z4mH00ZqN1j6reO0w.text: First of all I would like to start with the warm smiles and genuine greeting from all the staff . The servers were very  tentative. They took the time to print out Cinderella pictures for my daughter to color. Also recognizing it was my fiance's birthday . They uniquely set up a table so romantic and catering to the specific occasion. The general manager of the compass Marcy set aside time To give her best wishes to my fiance. I couldn't be more grateful FOR the amount of service my family and I received. The positive energy was so magnetic. Amazing food Amazing people breathtaking view for any occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w__GCz6W-MZkwpTTpJVycw.text: Brought my girlfriend here for an early Valentine's Day dinner. Ambiance is great with the restaurant on top of the hotel overseeing all of downtown Phoenix. The staff is very welcoming, however, a bit slow bringing drinks from the bar. It was a Friday night but wasn't super busy to the point I had to wait 1/2 hour for a beer. Food was really good, especially the green chili cornbread!!! Price was what you would expect for similar establishment. Would recommend in the future for a special occasion. Good overall experience.

wHII83Rsx_ZLMXdkp2bbWg.text: Good restaurant. The highlight is the rotating dining area. Food was pretty good, service was alright. I had the fillet mignon and ended up getting violently ill a few hours later. These things happen, and of course it wasn't intentional, but getting food poisoning from a $150 meal isn't quite what I was looking to take away from our anniversary dinner.

2_uS2lAzM2enLLpac3UKIQ.text: We decided to grab a drink or two here for my birthday and were greeted by the hostess with "Just so you know, it's last call." Um, okay, what happened to "Hi, how are you?" or "How many?". Isn't it bad enough that last call on Saturday night is at 10:15 without being rude to your customers?  So whatever, we told her there we six of us and I spied these really cool lounge pits sunken into the floor and lined with luxurious couches. Hell yes, it's my birthday and I am dressed to the nines so I want the James Bond fancy couch pit.  Well not so fast, instead the hostess walks us to a table which I can only describe as something you might see sitting on someones porch holding up a fancy potted plant. So I point to the empty couch area and ask if we can sit there. She starts dragging chairs over to this tiny table and says "This is the lounge area." To which I reply "Right, well it's my birthday and I want to sit over there." (Mind you the place is empty except for another group of about 4 or 5 SITTING IN ANOTHER ONE OF THE COUCH PITS.)  She just replies back "This is the lounge area." My  group reluctantly starts sitting down but I decided that since we were in walking distance of a zillion other bars and restaurants we should just leave. I announced to the group "Lets go somewhere else, I'm out, eff the Compass Room". Then I turned and walked right to the elevator.  As my group hurried to catch up the manager followed me to the elevator to tell me I had to leave while a waitress told my boyfriend I was clearly a no-serve. Yeah, okay "eff the Compass Room" is strong language but I was LEAVING. You can't kick me out, I am leaving. And no, I'm not drunk, just offended at the poor customer service and rude hostess. If you wont seat me where I want to be seated when you bar is DEAD and I have money to spend then I have every right to leave.  What a lame experience. Thumbs down for sure. No wonder no one ever goes there.

Ip7WTLV9WWkTtI1thkOVmQ.text: Had dinner before the opera at Compass, made reservations through open table. Neither open table or the restaurant website mention that they validate hotel parking--so dont park anywhere but the hotel.   We were greeted three times at the host station before we were seated, which wasn't bad just weird. The table setting and dining room ambiance is strictly hotel standard--don't expect to wow anyone with that. Tired maroon cloth napkins. Horrible lacquer table tops. The average age in the place was definitely high sixties. The view however was awesome. And the rotation was slow enough to be peaceful and fast enough to keep it exciting.  The service was extremely awkward. It was like a symphony of the socially inept. It felt like the wait staff at Denny's somehow got their big break and had a five minute crash course in "fine dining" and ran with it. There were no specials, which was a red flag for me. And the first round of drinks came in glasses that were so water spotted and gross, I was embarrassed for the server. The martinis were watery and tiny. The food was acceptable but entirely unremarkable and overpriced. Pass on the NY steak if you are expecting anything thick.  This is definitely a second stop, beer/wine only place. Skip the food, skip the cocktails. Pre drink someplace else, show up here, sip beer or a bottle of wine [I would not trust a by the glass here] while you spin and get your parking validation.

xyee1ifpme9PiCfIQRWSzg.text: Let's get the boring bad  stuff out of the way so I can talk about the fun part.  over-priced not delicious you have two people waiting on you, but it's always slow bad water- seriously, not even a lemon can mask the disgusting flavor of their water it's always cold  honestly, if this restaurant wasn't high up and spinning, i would never go here.  i took my nieces ice skating at city scape so i figured this would be a fun place to have an over priced dinner since we were right up the street. When in Rome....or something.  I ordered some curry chicken thing and my nieces had grilled cheese off the kids menu.  we also ordered a molten cake for dessert but there was no molten? whatever, no need to to hash it because i knew going in the food sorta sucks.   Our bill was $70 but we seriously had a blast. The whole dinner was filled with gasps and excitement and sheer thrill about how fun this restaurant was.

pkFBN2nrac_8GrZXlM5sXA.text: Good food. Service was good too but a little slow. It seemed busy. Steak was perfect. View was amazing.

SjyPvNWDKJz3gBPDjk9_IA.text: This was a great experience as part of our Spring Training trip to Arizona. We heard about the Super Moon and though there would be no better place to view it than from high above Phoenix.  We were lucky to get a reservation hours before.   The staff at Compass was terrific.  The hostesses at the front were extremely friendly and enjoyed viewing the Super Moon also. We were quickly seated and served a chili corn bread that is fantastic. They do give you the recipe upon request. Our dinner,, we both had steak, was very good, but also very pricey.  Yes you do pay for the view.  I must say this was a great experience.  This is a great restaurants for special occasions.

eqbD1631jzZZWFbZvq6Y3w.text: fourth time coming here. most romantic reasturant i've ever been too, great lighting, great music, AMAZING food. you'll never be disappointed here.

zu_TNw0BXKZZ-Oqf1ZyBKg.text: Came to this restaurant with no real expectations other than a place that 'rotated' and had a 'nice view.' To my surprise it was a fine dining restaurant, with a SPECTACULAR VIEW, and service was great/enjoyable (Patty was so upbeat and a great server in general). The atmosphere set it apart from any place I had been to before. Perfect for a romantic night with my girlfriend or a place to celebrate a special occasion with friends. Beyond the atmosphere and great view, the food was delicious. I had the NY strip and it was cooked just right. Everything from our appetizer to dessert was so good. Even the bread, which was a jalapeno cornbread, was great. Although it is pretty pricey, it's definitely worth the money.

pVt2UOwz0j_1wMwOVcsUGg.text: Amazing view of the downtown Phoenix area, and it rotates! Gotta try dinner at sunset up there for a really great experience. Really quite and relaxing atmosphere, I can't think of anywhere else in Phoenix that you can get a view like this from.

irllODN6--Wq1BnS1XdGRQ.text: The Compass at Hyatt Regency has a lot to offer.  This is a revolving restaurant that gives you a 360 degree view of the city of Phoenix.  I suggest you ask for a wall seat for the best views.  The information cards were very nice to let you know what you were looking at from above.  I think this is something that the Indianapolis Eagle's nest should offer.  The food is good, it is on the expensive side.  The service is great.  Overall, I was impressed.

Kltt6cXRHsS8wzdWxvFSbQ.text: Menu is well thought out - good variety.   The service was perfect: not hovering, but attentive.   And of course, the whole reason for dining there: the view - incomparable.    I had the lamb.  When it came out I was wondering where the rest of the meal was, but as I ate, I realized the rest was deeper in the dish.  Not a flat plate but more like a large bowl with a super wide rim.  And it was really good (bit on the fatty side if you're watching your cholesterol).  House cab was respectable, too.

5vnjSYYI-WmY-95qbc3Ebg.text: Great View! Over Priced! Over Rated! Don't waste your money! Food was blah! Try one of the MANY great places to eat at street level in downtown.

W6SxOGIxNl99UeCb-x7U4w.text: 4/4/13: 5pm Thursday night dinner, made reservations but the restaurant wasn't full. Restaurant rotates once around every hour, a little kitschy at first and queezy for anyone with motion sickness, I liked the overall experience! I ordered a pulled beef short rib cannoli covered with a mushroom cream sauce. A bit salty, I didn't finish all three pieces -sauce is very rich! Beautiful sunset from here!

cTH2pUij3TlOHoXUw98iEw.text: The experience was great! Dinner for two in a restaurant that provides more than the basics. The staff was excellent. The food very tasty and just enough to leave room for a delicious desert.  Pricing was good for the scenic and unconventional restaurant experience.  I will be back!

88hD-XI1lm-0ecKxcW38UA.text: The food did not merit the $36 - $38 price for an entree. We had the Sea Scallops and Filet.  The filet was presented overdone and tough.  They did change out the filet, but by that time I finished my entree....scallops, which were nothing special.  If the view is more important than the meal...try Compass.  If you want a meal worth that price range....go somewhere else.

mnT0O_mRhUVpqm_zYMlkbw.text: Don't  waste your time with a full meal. Maybe go for just a drink and dessert to experience the cool revolving restaurant (however don't bring your own drink - this is a serious faux pax & they will threaten to call the cops on you) . Otherwise the food is not great and the service is horrible. Very bad experience. :(

0vRml3ZJTIZVZfX2IYHdbA.text: The food (ribeye) was good, the service was excellent, and the views great. So why 3 stars?  Price. The steak was decent - about the same as an Outback Steakhouse. If you want a great view, then go. If you want good food, there are alternatives and you'll save a lot.

-i9yFtJGeRmPRyH6ydl_uw.text: This restaurant's manager, Marcie, asked our client's daughter to leave because she took a tiny sip of her mother's wine and Marcie did it in an extremely rude, unprofessional manner that was 100% uncalled for and unnecessary. I would never recommend this restaurant if you or your clients want to actually be treated with respect. Marcie was extremely threatening and should NOT be working in the hospitality industry. She also told our client that her daughter had better not go into the other hotel venues and they would be watching her. This is unacceptable behavior. Our waitresses (Lindsey and one other woman) were very nice however. Yay on the food and waitresses but screw the management. And this is a party of 15 they treated like this; they must not want business.

vOa5JWr5cbeEsp6adWOAkw.text: I have been to the Compass Grill several times before...the views are amazing and the food in the past has been just ok.  However, this time I had the salmon and a wedge salad and both were prepared very well.  I am a realtor who deals with lots of out of town buyers and always recommending places to eat to clients.  Originally had tried to get in on Saturday night but they were booked till 8:00 so agreed to do Sunday.  When we arrived hostess tried to sit us in table and not in booth as we requested when I said I would wait they seamed a little put off by this...even though there were numerous booths available she said she would have to clean it and it would be about 10 minutes...I agreed this was OK and just thought it was not like they were packed and should be more accommodating when there were more seats available.  Might want to rethink your seating on slower nights as they tried to get another couple after us to sit right next to us and they declined as well wanting a more desirable table.

WJjnqcHaa4h9CtmMAtGVgw.text: The food is mediocre and is overpriced. They give out very small portions and the wait was very long. The fish is very dry and tasteless. The steaks had no flavor. The only reason to come here is the view, the food needs some improvement.

hjuRI2U_Qoae67qdBBuAgg.text: Good food...Amazing veiw... Excellent service.. I love a place with history and a story to tell..Definitely should be on the things to do in .phoniex. You will drop some coin. Left us spinning

g5Q6wnt2WakLzOyx0yjk_A.text: The place was amazing! The restaurant is a real compass! We managed to see the whole Phoenix while Eating! The food was not so tasteful. I ordered the scallops and there was so much oil in my plate :(

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scallop

CSWxlkpWXMXBZk_-wspC_w.text: I've been to the Compass Room for intimate dinners, small group dinners, and even a large group event/dinner. It has been a hit each time so, from my experience, they're much more than a spinning restaurant on the top of the Hyatt. I have always found their service to be on point, the staff friendly, and the food is excellent -- I am personally a fan of their steaks. Plus, if you need a photo or a view for dinner, you can not go wrong here.

a09_4ibI2bTlg20XbJfJ4A.text: This place was incredible and the food blew our minds not to mention the view.  The real deal!  I would highly recommend this place to any local or visitor.

UhziYcu9BEfd3Be7TxCPiA.text: Everytime we come here, the view is unbeatable, the service is friendly, and the food is always very worth the price. But be warned, if you come on a popular night like Friday, don't even bother making a reservation, my wife and I still had to wait about half an hour just to be seated. The seating area for waiting is comfortable, but very awkwardly close to the elevators. Overall a very excellent experience, once you do get seated!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our drinks, my simple but lovely angry orchard beer, and my wife got an interesting specialty alcoholic hot chocolate. Look at that view!

xl2iXhRa34zsgrL_D3vIeQ.text: We stayed at the Hyatt for a convention in July. We decided to have dinner one evening at the compass restaurant, and we were blown away. It is such a nice restaurant, great staff and beautiful views. The rotation is so slow, my mom didn't even believe we were moving at first. The food was just great. We ordered the cheese fondue plate, and between that and the bread it really filled us up. I also had a Caesar salad, and my mom had a side dish but I don't recall which one. It was more than enough food and we left feeling full and happy. Would definitely like to return again someday!

HX4yyfSSiZewjhdZlxhHDw.text: The views are spectacular. Make reservations if you're able to. The bar doesn't require reservations. Everything I've ordered has been great, the service is top notch and it's made its way into our regular "rotation" of restaurants.

PrpWEAdDAL5KzJSVuRLSkA.text: The only thing I liked about this place is it's view around the city.  Wouldn't recommend if you are looking for good food.  Also, our check was charged wrong literally 3 times in the same visit.  Make sure to check that they don't charge you service charge twice.

sdOeVmYKuTUaVZlZh13udQ.text: I have lived in the Valley a long time and have never been here.  We went for hubby's 60th birthday.   We all really enjoyed the view.   Prices are high, but that was expected. Service was great   My only drawback, for the price, I expected out of the ordinary.  The appetizers were hum-drum and the same that you can get anywhere - crab cakes, bruschetta, etc.  Where's the creativity?????  The dessert menu was no different   The main dishes were great - steak was cooked perfectly.    I would recommend this if you want to 'wow' people with the view or want to celebrate a special occasion.

XgnUMDyK3NrB2zZJWSnGhA.text: We had dinner here last night and the service was impeccable. We were seated right away and right next to the window as we requested. Delicious drinks and appetizers. Somewhat limited options for vegetarians but they definitely had some and seemed willing to make substitutions as needed. I got one of the salads without cheese and it did not disappoint - I ate every last bit. Views were very pretty and it was overall a lovely night out. Would recommend.

uCS4y7xWhOov1XXV6CTlWg.text: I enjoyed the food and the view. I got there just in time for sunset and it was amazing to see. The food was good, it was pricey for what you get though. I suppose overall you're paying for the ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunset view
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scallops with sweet potato ravioli

TUhkT1mIKLqQyjKXkVwvcg.text: Came here to celebrate our anniversary. Beautiful views 360 of the city. Nice comfortable seating. We had the lobster bisque and the Brie to start and both were delicious. Then I had the fillet with mash potatoes which was cooked to a perfect medium, although it was garnished with some lettuce which was kind of wilted and sad looking would have been a nicer presentation without it. my boyfriend had the scallops which the scallops and risotto were great but the beets and goat cheese on the plate were not quite as great.  Our server Maria was very attentive and friendly.  We had the creme brulee trio for dessert. ( hot coco, cranberry orange and maple pecan)  Overall a great night out

w06MF2YzV19tqYxcst5fxA.text: You can't get a better view from a restaurant definitely worth staying for a couple hours . As for the food it is a little pricey but your definitely paying for the view and being that the restaurant spins you get to see the entire city . Definitely a great date night you can't go wrong , they also validate parking so be sure to do that before you leave.

O2FYoUn29EGvVILMSa5EeQ.text: We were in downtown Phoenix. I had purchased tickets for a nearby show and we decided to try the Compass Arizona Grill for our evening meal. The Compass was located on top of the Hyatt Regency and provided a 360 degree view of the Valley .... in what I understand to be the only revolving roof-top restaurant in Arizona.   Our visit to the Compass was on a Friday night about 6:00 pm, just after the Thursday Thanksgiving holiday. The place was not that busy but it was early and most folks were probably full & at home (& not ready to go out for dinner) after the big meal many had the day before.  After getting off the elevator, we were quickly shown to our table that was next to a window ...... that provided a specular view of the city. We did not know much about this place when making reservations. It took us a few minutes to notice that the view outside was changing due to the slow rotation. What a great visual perspective this venue provides. We later learn that it takes just over 1 hour to complete one revolution letting you enjoy so much of the Phoenix area during that period.   The wait staff was very good - professional and efficient. I appreciated the way the various servers covered for one another to help ensure every tables' needs were met quickly.    We started with wine and sparkling water. I chose a B.R.Cohn Cabernet from Kenwood, CA and my best friend ordered a Franciscan Napa Chardonnay. Our salads choices were the same - the Southwest Caesar with Heirloom Tomato, Manchego and Noble Cumin Croutons. Very nice variation on the traditional Caesar - I liked it a lot. The small (versus large) portion salad was most generous.    For the main meal, my wife ordered the Braised Lamb Shank which she liked .... Even the corn polenta and she is typically not a polenta fan. My salmon was disappointing. It was very much over cooked, consequently dry and the crust fell off the fish as it was served. We did not have time to return it to the kitchen (but I should have at least complained). Anyway, I would not recommend the fish --- based on this one experience.  We opted for expresso and brandy ... for dessert. A triple shot kept me going for the evening.

The food was delicious, from the appetizer to the bread I was very impressed. It's definitely worth it to splurge on yourself once in awhile.

vKDL03peZJ26dUDYH_FSGQ.text: Food & Service here is truly a blessing with these spectacular views of the city of PHX. I'll come again soon. This place is great for birthday parties and company parties as well. Awesome experience

7NPXY5bSIRAiYXaA090VvA.text: I had really high hopes for this place.  I was in town for a conference and wanted to meet up with a friend who now lives down here.  He said he could meet me at my hotel, which I was staying at the Hyatt Regency just below this restaurant with a fantastic location, set-up and view.  What better to do than to get us a reservation, which was pretty easy to do, the lady on the phone was really nice, and come up here for some food, drinks, enjoy the view and catch up.  Like I said, I wanted to like this place, but the service fell very short.  It took a minute to be seated, and we got a great window seat where you can see for miles around in every direction as the restaurant slowly turns round and round.  I should have known something was wrong as the couple seated next to us (and after us) had their orders taken and their drinks arrive before we got our menus.  After taking our order it took quite a long time for us to get our food (and drinks... the easy part).  Once we got our food, our waitress disappeared.  She was no where to be found.  I asked someone for a drink refill and was told I would have to ask my waitress.  I finally asked again and their response was, "did you ask your waitress?"  I said i still haven't seen her...  There are now two employees, who could have been taking care of other customers, looking for our waitress.  By the time she was found and returned to our table I was done.  We wanted to order another side and perhaps dessert, and get more drinks but I was done.  She said something about the kitchen being busy...  I asked her to just get my check, she didn't seem to thrilled but finally brought it back. As for the food, I had the filet which was pretty good.  The food and view were great, but for the price I definitely need better service.  We also met earlier in the evening and the restaurant was not close to full yet.  If I am back in the area, I probably wouldn't risk paying for poor service again.  I got to experience it once, see the view and catch up.  I'd rather try my luck elsewhere.

CN3XUhZnBoFFEN55r8pQBg.text: We ate at Compass Arizona Grill this past weekend. We started with blue masa calamari and gazpacho shrimp cocktail. The calamari was great. Not being able to eat gluten I haven't been able to eat fried calamari in years. This was the first time I've seen blue masa calamari. The shrimp cocktail was ok. It has a very strong citrus flavor which my family didn't like at all. It actually kind of ruined the flavor of the seafood itself. My daughter and I split a filet and potatoes. The filet had a great taste. The vegetables were pretty undercooked and under flavored.  My four year old ordered the petit steaks off the kids meal and the steaks had an odd taste. They had a strange spice to them, seemed like they had way too much pepper on them. Our waiter was nice but there was a young guy helping the waiter who was named David. He was amazing.  He should be waiting his own tables, not just helping. He anticipates your needs and seems very proactive.   The view of course was great and the kids loved that it rotated and you could see all the different parts of the city.

0tHGCr4F5cF4mWX8Xm9uYQ.text: Came here to grab some drinks before heading to the comedy show nearby. Wonderful atmosphere and great service by friendly staff. The rotating views were wonderful! Would definitely check it out again!

j10E5c_hZoWEmdCsa-7sWQ.text: Went here for my birthday. The view is really great so that's definitely something for tourists to do. The food though was super mediocre. You would think for a place like this the chef would make sure the chicken wasn't dry. However, the service was great, they gave me a blanket since I was cold and they were super attentive. Dessert was delicious too!

TANpqYZHVLyVDKD4eODgYw.text: Service sucks... doesnt match the ambiance or the price per plate.  We asked for a window seat while making our reservation and we showed up on time, but they said no.  Our waiter took forever to greet us or give us water so i asked an employee passing by for some bread and she replied unhelpfully that we need to order an entree in order to receive bread.  Dennys has better service than this joint.  Our slow server finally arrived and he never told us what the special was for that night.  I asked and he said it was some type of fish.  I asked if it came w anything else and he replies, " just some vegetables".  Omg, the scallop plate is like $39 (which was delish) but the wait staff education and service needs to match the cost per plate we are paying.  I swear dennys has better service!  Thumbs down! View was amazing but i hesitate to come back bc of service...probably not.

fycZOT7wUgrNqaBdcy-nxQ.text: Made reservations, arrived on time and was seated 5 min later. Ordered an appetizer, drinks, & three entrees including the salmon, chicken and a chicken salad. After waiting 50 min for the food to be served, I asked the server how much longer we would have to wait for our food. Ten minutes later, the food arrived. Clearly, our order had been lost. No apology or explanation was given. The Chicken on the Salad was very dry and there was no dressing on the salad. The other entrees were moderately acceptable but a poor representation of what should be served at these prices. As the room rotated it also became increasingly colder. Other fine dining restaurants offer much better food and great views in the Valley. First time to try this place after living here for many decades. Very disappointing overall. Sadly, I would not recommend this place.

pokB_zEXotTqc4d1K3hHFQ.text: We had a great time here. The staff was very personable and made the experience that much better. The views were great as we got there right around sunset. Little plaques on the wall as it was turning was a nice touch. The food was great and we definitely want to come back. It's higher in price but it's definitely a good place for date night.

JtX8Gf5Lx42pqXUbXrRRDw.text: This is a very nice restaurant.  The view was fabulous in the spinning dining room.  I thought it was pricey.  Food was great. Service was awsome.  I would visit the Compass again.

IM0GVS-ovSj26evarpKehA.text: Nice view but the food isn't very good for the money. Our server could tell we were disappointed.  He bought us dessert because five of us had our food twenty minutes before the other person in our party.

1DIyTR-TICS_mJ2HhNKHcw.text: This restaurant is located on top of Hyatt Regency.  It is a revolving restaurant with an amazing view.  I was staying at the Hyatt and I had opted for to go.  I ordered the Salmon, which was delicious and the Creme Brulee Trio - Vanilla Bean, Green Tea and Pomegrante, it is to die for!!  Next time, I will have to have a sit down dinner to experience the True revolving feel.

5l_fZGfSJc63XYjxmNqbiw.text: Compass Grill is always a treat. You can't beat the views, they are all part of the experience you pay for. The food is top notch and not outrageously priced. It's not an every nigh meal, more like a once a year meal. The food is ok, nothing really special, especially for the price, you're paying for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

81zNn2caXE3ZNnY3ga9KJQ.text: Was really excited to try this place. It has been a historic staple in the city of Phoenix for years. The atmosphere was very cool and modern. The spinning of the restaurant was a little off putting for the first two minutes then we got used to it. After that it was very cool. The food took a little long to get to us but when it did it was delicious. Me and my wife were seated next to a party of about ten that was kind of loud. And when I say seated next to I mean RIGHT next to. Our table was getting bumped as they got up to take a million selfies. Other then that it an overall good experience. I would go back.
