Gph4bTyW_7NSaYe1rrN5nA.text: Food was great service was very good also. Very beautiful view from the restaurant very pretty at sun set.

ED_odq-qrFuYHVNEkwLm4w.text: Turned out to be an amazing dinner date. The place was perfect, the view was just amazing. This restaurant is just a gem in the middle of the desert. Icing on the cake is the service. JACOB our waiter was amazing at his service n many a times he went a step ahead to serve n make us happy. 10 on 10. Coming to the menu n food. Little pricey so watch out but worth paying for all the things ur getting. We had wine, lamb chops n sandwich. Chops just blew my mind. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4BvcTCoZiDNwmK9BXhCGZw.text: Beautiful views. Great place in a dated hotel. Steak medallions were excellent. Great for special occasions or some pricy cocktails to celebrate. The black and white dessert is excellent.

yvaSBFxsuIynUk2TK-U68w.text: I went here with my boyfriend for our 2 year anniversary. We hadn't heard many good reviews about the food but I figured it was worth a shot to try it out ourselves. The food was good, but not good enough to justify the expensive prices. However, that wasn't the problem.  We had ordered a $40 bottle of wine, which was a Robert Mondavi. We aren't very familiar with wine and didn't thoroughly review the wine list, so we weren't aware that there were multiple Mondavi wines on the list. When the waitress brought out the bottle, she explained it as the House wine, and we didn't see 'Mondavi' anywhere on the label.  When I asked if that was the Robert Mondavi, she responded, "Oh, you want the M?". When I asked if this was the Mondavi, she said yes so we had it brought out. The bottle said 'Mondavi' on it so when she asked if this was it, we assumed it was.  Turns out this was a $255 bottle of wine, a far cry from the $40 bottle we wanted. The waitress did NOT say that the original wine was in fact a Mondavi when I asked and instead brought out one of their most expensive bottles.  It really was just a huge miscommunication, but the manager was extremely rude and not only threatened to call the cops and have us arrested for theft, but then proceeded to talk poorly about us in the kitchen, which we could hear. We ended up getting a small discount from the check but in the end I was extremely unimpressed with our service and definitely would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Not worth the views.

V_CGW6UDpmHlnuFYVB_4PQ.text: It was a very nice environment. The service was excellent! Definitely a beautiful view at night. While the room spun very slowly, my wife felt a little bit of dizziness at first. If you're prone to dizziness, you might want to avoid this restaurant.  The food was a mix. My wife loved the shrimp (3huge shrimp, $18). The lobster chowder was also great (though perhaps a bit too much corn). She also enjoy the calamari, though the sauce was a little too tarter sauce like. I had the crab cakes (spot on) and the chicken dinner. The chicken was flavorful, if not a bit too salty. The Brussels and quinoa were the best part of the dish.  I had the Hefenweizen ~:] It was a god local brew, yet my frugality only allowed me to order two, knowing I just paid the equivalent of a twelve pack...yep.  Most people are likely the same as us, come for the experience. If this is you, it's worth it at least once. Just make note, if you get dizzy easily, it may not be for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken was a little salty. The shrimp were absolutely delicious! Calamari was good, sauce not so much.

NY2DEJvggQTAOWyYpeSmNA.text: I read a few unfavorable reviews, and I can't say I see where they were coming from. We went for my wife's birthday. This is the second time I've eaten here, but the last was about 3 years ago. First off, the views were magnificent to say the least. The staff was extremely attentive and polite. The food was delicious. We had the blue maza calamari for an appetizer. I had the lobster bisque soup. This would be my only gripe as I didn't find any lobster meat in the soup; however, the flavor was rich, creamy, and tasty. I had the braised lamb shank and my wife had the mixed seafood pasta. The lamb was fall-off-bone tender. My wife said the seafood pasta was excellent. I can honestly say that I would pay these prices for the food without the views.

2kvctysv4xfOcp89L3kwdw.text: Great views of course and as your spinning looking at the city there's little plaques of history to let you know what you are looking at. The service was good and very professional, but they did not take us back on time for our reservation which we did arrive 5 min earlier and we still were taken back 20 minutes after. I will be honest we were scared to try their food and we were mainly there for the wine and view due to previous reviews. We did keep our dishes simple and I had a salad and their posele. It was okay I was not super impressed by their dishes considering the type of restaurant it is, but then again we kept it very simple with our meals. I would come back, but again it's more for the views and the wine for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bottle of wine with a view

h7cNGktEW4DCw2KGaGgXmw.text: The view was gorgeous, I loved that the restaurant spun giving you a complete view the city.  The environment is great for date night.    The dress code is not really consistent.  One couple next to us was dressed to the nines and then at the next nearby table they were in workout clothes... so wear really whatever you want and you'll be fine!   The service was not the best, our server seemed to go MIA a lot and when he was around he wasn't very friendly. As far as the food goes, some dishes were amazing and others were just average.  We loved the complementary jalapeno cornbread, I wish they brought us more! We each ordered a filet mignon and split the Mac and cheese, Brussels sprouts, and cheesy potatoes. The steaks were good! The cheesy potatoes were my favorite side of the three, the other two sides were just average in comparison to other similar restaurants.  We got the trio cream brulee... don't bother with this dessert, it sounds better than it actually is.  I can honestly say that the only reason I'd return to this restaurant is for the view and the cornbread.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio cream brûlée - traditional, snickerdoodle, and orange/cranberry.  Would not recommend this dish.
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. On plate: Petite filet mignon, Mac and cheese (triangle), and small aids salad (comes with meal)

Dp-iPLAO5sCc-qIhY9xcrw.text: Amazing view and original concept!!! Now that that is out of the way we can focus on the important stuff Food and Drinks. I am a foodie so when I go to a place I don't really mind the price as long as the quality of the food  justifies it. I ordered the salmon and risotto dish. Salmon was cooked to perfection, won't say it wasn't, but I was not seasoned. Risotto was gluggy and the chayote was not fully cooked. For dessert I had the queso fresco and churro cheesecake, it was ok but we all agreed the best part of it was the tiny churro ring it had on top.  My cousins were not impressed by the food either.

0B9y43PpCJl4Ul0sEq8i6A.text: Compass is by far my favorite restaurant, we come several times per year. The food is always better than I anticipated (I get the porterhouse, salad, garlic mashed potatoes and a 18 year scotch)   The rotating view is the best in the city (takes an hour to go all way around).  This is the perfect place for a birthday, date anniversary, or quiet evening out. (It was my birthday)   The only draw back continues to be the wait staff. They lack the manners and respect to serve a $200 meal.   Alas I am not a fancy dresser, I work hard to wear what I want and do what I want. But that does not excuse you to act like we are at mcdonalds, it is sad to see the busing/water staff to have more manners and respect then my waitress. I wish they were the ones serving me.   I will return, to enjoy the food again. But I know what to expect and you should too.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

A_0vzeWr7PVwX-IcDKi_-w.text: My girlfriend was leaving for boot camp the next day, so we really wanted to do something special. The scenery was beautiful at sunset and our food was seriously to die for. My mac n cheese was seriously delicious. Of course, the price point is high & we knew that going in to it. Our waiter was attentive and super nice.

TYTde-5GJ3Fn34u8SA7EXw.text: 24th floor of Hyatt downtown phx at 7pm on a Sunday; No wait, great service, food was enjoyable(but nothing to write home about) HOWEVER the VIEW was totally worth the visit...for a view like that you normally wld hike 40mins up camelback. Prices decent, wont break the bank. Totally recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waiter asked, so shared it was friends bday server stated&#34;We can take care of dessert if u choose&#34;..no discount or free bday dessert given
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 199.97 for 2 dinners,2 dessert, 3 cocktails.
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mxBZ2HU4_GJ0UK2mAjk6rQ.text: I have been coming to the compass grill since it had a brunch buffet. Every time I come back, it reminds me of the days as a kid where I would put on a nice dress and get dolled up to head out with my dad here and drink fresh orange juice.   I have spent many birthdays here as well and will never get over the speedy elevator ride and ambiance that allows me to embrace downtown phx in all of it's glory. Ironically enough, those rides out to dtphx as a kid is what sparked my infatuation and drove me to move just blocks away.   5 stars for everything. Food, staff, environment, service, refreshments, memories.

ljGN_-AIlw2QPtcE3D8cQQ.text: Celebrated my 35th birthday here with my husband. We had a great meal and enjoy the view of this city as we took two trips around the 365 degree track. Would suggest this place for anniversaries, special birthday, or just a very special night in general. Slightly pricey but definitely worth it.

b93xysm0dlncHVjr2NNRpQ.text: Excellent customer service and great food too and amazing view. I advise to book in few days or weeks advance because it fills up fast

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Michele Chiarlo La Couqs Baqbeqa k&#39;Arsm Stheqmoqe Nmzza , Piedmont Barbara , Italy , 2010 I guess lol
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chase field

xYwZKjr8zqYemiEgqQ7vHA.text: Very nice spot for special occasions, the service was great! The menu had many choices including vegetarian, very well labeled as well. (Gluten free,vegan & vegetarian) I made a reservation and was seated immediately so I recommend doing that before coming. Very nice seating, even if you're not by a window you can still enjoy the view.  And also great wine selection!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Fxkfg24fLUcvcuGRFwdVtw.text: Worth the money. My girlfriend had such an amazing time here and we will definitely be coming back!   We started out with the brie fondue. Mon Dieu!!! Tres bon. It comes with bread and a variety of fruits to dip into either the brie or into a fruit jam.   We moved into the main course with the Flat Iron Steak. Both of us went for it and got different steak sauces to complement the DELICIOUS steak. I ordered a side of crispy brussel sprouts with bacon jam and my SO got the mashed potatoes. Y u m . com .   We finished the night with asparagus drizzled with fig balsamic and the constant influx of cornbread and sweet bread straight out of the oven. Everything was so GOOD.  Staff were very professional. Venue was spectacular. We booked for 7pm and caught the sunset perfectly. Wonderful time with my beautiful girlfriend. One area of opportunity is the price. Yes, the food is magnificent but it doesn't warrant the price. I would frequent the establishment at a much higher rate if they cut prices by 10-15%.

NvVF10OZ72stTB3o3TajEg.text: If your gonna splurge this a place to do so. Since this was a special occasion I most likely would not return. Overpriced to say the least but that comes with the rotating seating , however I was impressed with the salmon,wild caught and not farm raised from what they said. My dinner was the salmon, broccolini and mushroom risotto. The fish portion was decent and cooked to perfection, lacking flavor, lemon etc; which was given after the waitress asked how our meal was. The customer service was average for the caliber of dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

roctEJnxSpp890BaCgwrLg.text: Hopefully by know you know that the Compass Arizona Grill rotates at the top of the Hyatt Regency, downtown.  We had already had dinner somewhere else and stopped there only for an appetizer, desserts, and cocktails.  We had a reservation but they did not have a table by the window in the main dining area (as I had requested), so we were offered to wait or sit by some high chairs in a separate section (next to the windows).  Well, we chose the high chairs and this turned out great, we had way more privacy and our server Karla was amazing.  The views of course are great, and the food was exquisite. My favorite was the brie fondue, delicious.  Next, we had a flight of creme brulee, and it was very unique. Hubby liked the cobbler too.  Overall a nice experience.  It is a bit pricey, but with those views you can consider it the cost of entertainment too : )  Very nice place for a special occasion, specially during sunset and night time. If you are curious, it takes about an hour for the restaurant to rotate full 360 degrees.

gMge-fwy7ycIiTXo5RsInQ.text: It was absolutely gorgeous inside and they really catered to my boyfriend and I's needs. He had the pork chop which was so phenomenally good with the jam and the bread they brought out. I got the pasta with black truffles and it was the best pasta I've ever tasted. Would 10/10 recommend coming here for any special event!

nGzpMyRCau10aQRMH1oFJg.text: My boyfriend and I spent our first anniversary at Compass and this place gave me mixed feelings. The view is amazing, as the restaurant spins around and you can see the whole downtown Phoenix. Be careful with motion sickness though.  The food doesn't impress me very much, but it tastes okay Parking is not convenient and as we were late for the reservation, we decided to go for the valet. Later we were surprised that they charged us for 15 dollars :( Im general, Compass has the best view for special occasions, plus the customer service is excellent. I may come back for those reasons but probably not for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EWkoOzBuPaDel6nmo3RgSg.text: We went to the Compass AZ Grill for drinks on a Wed night. We wanted to have dinner but when I called for reservations they didn't have any available. However, when we were there in the cocktail area, there were dozens of available dining tables, so we suspect they have a labor shortage. The person I spoke to about reservations was curt and unhelpful at best. We were able to get a seat in the cocktail lounge and ordered a cheese board and drinks. The board was great. I had the Prickly pear margarita. It was very (too) sweet. The others' drinks were good.  The best thing was the view. It's amazing and worth going just for that.  I will say the food that we saw on diner's tables as we were walking out looked very good!

WBnd4XTv0cYJDwJQ5xRZSQ.text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday on a Sunday night.  We got there a little before sunset so we could watch the view, since the restaurant rotated above the top of the Hyatt hotel. We were able to see some amazing views of the mountains and watch the sunset! It looked just as pretty once the sun went down, seeing all the lights of the city below. It seemed like a full rotation took an hour. I saw another reviewer saying that the sun was in their eyes and they had to look at dirty rooftops below. Of course, the sun may be in your eyes at some point, and Compass can't control the conditions of the other buildings' rooftops! It was still a great view!  For dinner, we ordered the Gold Canyon filet mignon and Bistro steak medallions, with Bacon Brie Mac & Cheese and Garlic smashed potatoes, all of which were delicious! The steaks were cooked to perfection and super tender!  For dessert, we ordered the chocolate mousse cake and a peach/pineapple cobbler! I'm a chocolate lover, but that cobbler was to die for!  We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yzxmJbxyLFwNMV4DREbvKw.text: One disappointment after another. Best part about this meal is the good, but expensive cocktails. The layout of the restaurant is bad. We had a group of 6 and we were split between two tables with a gap between them, which made it weird for a business setting. The waitress was extremely slow and didn't offer to explain the menu, the sides, or offer any suggestions at all. She wasn't very personable either.   I ordered the braised lamb and it was fall of the bone, but had a distinctive gamey lamb flavor. I ordered the side of roasted brussel sprouts and I was extremely dissatisfied. The end stem of the sprouts wasn't cut off giving it a tough texture. They were also burnt, passed what I would consider roasted. Nothing about this experience would make me want to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Braised lamb shank

GoTbYaLOrUSBdhf_bbv86g.text: What a joke. A 40 minute wait for a drink with 10-15 open tables.  Good thing you're doing a $40 million dollar renovation.   Maybe you can put a bar in that area and let people come in for a cocktail at 9:30PM.  WOW!! Very disappointing

lfRimYruqCwNy5koG3-miQ.text: Went over the Valentine's Day weekend. Easy to make reservations, easy to find. It wasn't very busy and we got seated at the exact time our reservation was made for.   The view is AMAZING. The food and service was not, and that's why this has such a low rating.   I ordered the braised beef ribs and my date ordered the salmon I don't think I seen any resemblance of seasoning on either of our plates. Mine came with red potatoes and all I tasted was the olive oil they were fried in.   The food was very very bland and flavorless, for that price I'd expect at least a few sprinkles of salt and pepper.   Our waiter seem very disinterested, he never brought out bread to us and literally everyone around us (even people that sat in our same section 10 minutes AFTER us) received a basket of bread. We had the same waiter btw.   I would love to come back just to experience seeing the sunset but it would be for drinks only.   Cliff notes:  View - AMAZING  Food - Flavorless and bland Service - Meh.

Pt6tejiLCSeT8amEN1vuQA.text: Very disappointing meal. Steak was overcooked and dry. Mac and cheese was bland.  Service was slow. Seems to me they are charging for the view, and the quality of the food is secondary.

EB8EBYBRr25rHvskOTxupw.text: The view is decent, but I would say the food is subpar....I've had better at restaurants in Scottsdale. Went on a date night with my girlfriend to celebrate our anniversary and as a foodie the food was not as good as I thought it would be. Appetizer - veggie caprese was "meh" didn't feel like it excited my taste buds in the right way. I also ordered a beef stroganoff and although they said it was supposed to be "hand made" pasta, the texture of it felt weird because it was somewhat dried/fried on the outside and dough-y on the inside.   Service was good though as the manager there offered to take off the beef stroganoff because it wasn't good. We went to another restaurant after spending a short time there.

B-f1rKIWP1ZlCtSHan655g.text: My wife and I enjoy this place..The view is incredible if you are staying downtown to catch a game stay at the Hyatt the restaurant is on top of the building btw it moves 360 so you can see all of Phoenix. I suggest you make a reservation for around 7pm so you can see the sun go down.  The food is good but don't order anything that is seafood it more of a steak restaurant..I did not enjoy any of the seafood..sorry just being honest I am a seafood lover and lived in places that serve fresh seafood but we are talking about AZ no Oceans...lol. However, the steak and desserts are fantastic. BTW for you Military members the hotel offers a Military discount on rooms which are very reasonable prices  since you are staying downtown. BTW lots of things to do downtown games, concerts, clubs, opera, and bars all in walking distance..reminds me of downtown Seattle..a little...

XYCzg3ZmnLCue925mVFiAw.text: Customer service was not friendly, we also had to pay event parking in the garage across the street ($12) for 2 hrs because they did not tell us about the stamp for parking that would have made the parking free.

dAS4Dx4Kmk6Hta4ZKVsIWA.text: I keep reading to go for the view and not the food. I am particular about food and I loved my meal! I ordered the sea bass ad it was a huge and super fresh portion! I will admit the pesto rice was not super flavorful but I still wouldn't turn it down. They came out with gluten free bread slices for me when they noticed I was not eating the bread.   Y husband got the steak and loved it!  Of course the view is fantastic. The ambiance was very romantic with the dim lighting at night. Service was great too. I will certainly be back

5h9tXI6oAKnuhWcuyoieFQ.text: We went to Compass for my birthday dinner last night and will not be returning again.  My fiance told me after our disappointing dinner that he had called earlier in the day to confirm our reservation and notified them that it was my birthday.  He was told that they would greet me with a "Happy Birthday" at the door and then they would bring out a banner and candles with dessert. He told them that would be great because he knows I love surprises...  We showed up and gave the hostess the name on the reservation, but there was no birthday greeting.  That was fine with me because I wasn't expecting it.  Then, when we got to the table the hostess asked if we were celebrating anything, and we told her it was my birthday.  The waiter came by a moment later and also asked if we were celebrating anything, and once again we told him it was my birthday. Despite having asked about it, neither really acknowledged it.  It was like they were just reading from their script, but not listening to the answers.   The service was awkward from the very beginning - the waiter stood there waiting for our drink orders while we clearly were not ready (we were both trying to look at one wine list and passing it back and forth across the table), and then finally asked if we needed another moment.  We ended up ordering cocktails, and my pomegranate margarita was not good - it tasted heavily of sour mix.  I drank less than a third of it and decided it wasn't worth the calories.   I ordered the scallops for dinner and my fiance ordered the salmon.  Both were decent but unremarkable. The service remained awkward throughout dinner.  We were pretty full when it came time for dessert, so we decided to split the goat cheese cheesecake.  Once again, decent but unremarkable.  The disappointing part was that they didn't even put a candle in the dessert or decorate the plate or anything - so much for birthday pictures. And I didn't know to expect the banner, but my fiance was disappointed that they had told him about it but didn't follow through - he was really looking forward to surprising me.   This brings me to the worst part.  We spent over $100 on dinner - we had ordered salads, entrees, dessert, and drinks - and not only did they not really acknowledge that we were celebrating my birthday, they didn't even comp my dessert! This is the first restaurant I've ever been to that didn't do SOMETHING to acknowledge a birthday - whether it be a candle, special plate decoration, or at least free dessert.     Bottom line - the view was pretty, the food was mediocre, and the service was terrible.  So disappointing!

077uvWtKn7BNCq3lyJ8E_g.text: I have been to the Compass Grill four times before this visit and on all occasions the staff was professional and the food was phenomenal. I expected the fifth visit to be just the same, however, that did not play out in my favor. The atmosphere was just as great as it was in the times prior and the food was not bad at all. The problem, which ruined our night, was our waitress. Note, I have always experienced professional service when I come here, (exactly what should be expected at a high end restaurant). She was absolutely rude, unprofessional, and unaccommodating to any of our requests. I asked for a side of mashed potatoes and when they arrived at our table they were cold and dry. I politely apologized for the inconvenience and asked for them to be taken away. She responded by saying, "So, you just want me to take them back?" I looked at her with complete confusion. She checked on our table ONCE throughout the whole dinner which was a few hours. When we received our check, the mashed potatoes were still on the check and I let her be aware of that and she got super frustrated and didn't even apologize, her response was, "OMG, I forgot". THAT WAS IT. That was the end of our night, she never came back to apologize nor wish us a great rest of our evening, nor said thank you. Absolutely nothing. She came back and put the fixed check on our table and stormed off. I will definitely not be returning to the Compass Grill for a while after this disappointing service.

-50l4HClEpIgL83-VNx2mA.text: I am giving this review 4 stars because the service was not top notch. The restaurant itself was beautiful, food was outstanding, however our server could've been a little more happy with life in general. She just seemed like we were a bother and was not happy to be at work AT ALL. Other than that, our dinner was outstanding and just being at the top of Phoenix overcame whatever bad service we were given. I will definitely be back!

820_TpJ4mOGjKd0sAxvuyw.text: 2 stars and that's only for the view. Maybe go here for a drink only to enjoy the view.  The food was really not good and very overpriced .... The bacon wrapped pear appetizer tasted old and freezer burned. The Chilean sea bass wasn't bad honestly   The wine list leaves a lot to be desired. The service was very good I must say and again the view was great but won't be returning.

HaveFBRf5IuzzqvlEXJtkw.text: If you go, try their reverse happy hour!  It is a bargain that they charge only $5 for well drink and dessert at the rotating restaurant on the 24th floor. Although the Phoenix skyline isn't all that exciting, the restaurant still offers a nice view of the city.  If you are a tea drinker, the Compass offers Numi tea (my favourite) as well as Tazo. The peach upside down cake was generously portioned, but every component (cake/ice cream/tres leches sauce) on the plate was too sweet skyrocketing my blood sugar. I would have liked more peach slices on the cake...  Our server made a mistake of overcharging me (looking at the receipt, I noticed just right now...), but he was friendly and courteous. Next time, I'll double-check the bill before I sign and I should order a bread pudding or cheesecake!

oxpZmkf-q0kUX-1eN3zDoQ.text: The views are certainly worth the trip, but I'm not sure the prices are warranted. The corn bread was delicious as was the appetizer, one of the flatbreads. I had the eggplant cannelloni for my entree. It was good, but actually was filled with too much goat cheese. I might come again for dessert, but I likely wouldn't spend the money for the full meal.

vL4lrV6_WkuURaI6KVi-oQ.text: i loved the corned bread. the rest of the food was good and the service was great. since the food is expensive and it did not move me, i rated it ok.

Zl9-Pyrne_HsZgevpxw3dg.text: Great View! Went here for dessert  had several different things but the best was the strawberry short cake. This made it worth it all!  Didn't have dinner here so i gave it a 4 until next time.

yXDSCYAtiAqSPu9UMoVeXw.text: Brought my wife here for her birthday dinner on a Sunday evening.  THE FOOD  Our started was Bison Crudo, rather nice, certainly met my expectations. For the main course, I had a pork chop which was a bit dry but otherwise nicely done. I wouldn't refuse it if asked again. To top off the evening, I a Peach Upside Down Cake which was considerably larger than I expected and quite tasty.  SETTING  24th floor rotating restaurant in an area with barely any high rises... so yes, awesome. You get to see the valley in a way you can't see it anywhere else.  The sitting is nicely done in several separate compartments making it feel cozier. The rotational mechanism is a bit on the loud side, but not offensive.  SERVICE  Pleasant, quick and unobtrusive.  OTHER  Parking for a car higher than 6'5" can be an issue in the parking structure near by, so if you have a tall truck, you'll have to find something on the street.

5-Z4cWKjpBG2CHmISNk2zg.text: The view is the only reason to go. Food was nothing special nor were the drinks. Our server was only at our table to take our order then never saw her again, however the lady who filled our waters and boxed up leftovers, was sweet and on the ball. I almost asked for the tip to go solely to her. Speaking of the tip, I wrote "cash" on the tip portion of my credit card receipt and left her a $20 on a $90 check. When I got home afterwards on that Saturday night, I noticed my card was charged an extra 20%. I thought maybe it was their procedure that the charge would drop off (even though there was only 2 of us). It's now Monday and the 20% never dropped off and the charge has completely posted. I've called twice with no returned call as of yet. There's no way she's getting a $40 tip on a $90 bill when my original tip of $20 was waaayyy generous for the service/subpar food. I'll update once resolved.

zPy-MXVgL8sOL8bzXaWHyw.text: Honestly? Service was crap. Food was okay though we only had desserts. Drinks were a bit pricy for the quality but also good. They said they'd call our room when our table was ready and didn't. Then made excuses. Then gave us the slowest service ever.   But yes, the view was great.

FeY2F7DLZ98zzm1QL9U-nw.text: ***Do not go to this restaurant***.    I got food poisoned from eating on this restaurant and nearly go to the ER. I was sick for 1 week and missed work for a few days.  We dine first in July 2014 for my birthday dinner with friends.  They did not serve the food until after 2 hours.  My boyfriend complained to the manager of the restaurant and Hyatt and they sent us 2 complimentary dinner.  On October 4, 2014, Saturday we made reservation and used the complimentary dinner.  I had scallops, lobster soup and ice cream.  The lobster soup what made me sick  because that is the only meal my boyfriend did not tried.  After 3 hours I went to bed and my stomach start growling, I just ignore it until 2AM I start going  to the restroom from that time until Monday night I keep throwing up and having runs.  Monday morning I cannot get up from bed anymore.  I had called the nurse line of my insurance company and told them what happened, they told me to try to drink pedialite and keep eating soft foods.  The bad thing pedialite has a very high sodium and after drinking 1 bottle it gives me high blood pressure.  After what happened to me I will never eat to this restaurant again.

Q1KwKJK5bDjZQrM5SMyjWQ.text: Best meal I have had in a long, long time.  Bourbon filet was perfect and delicious accompaniments.  Service couldn't be better.  It really is as good as it gets accompanied by fabulous views of our beautiful Valley.  Make reservations and go!  You won't be sorry.

e5vCqS2a4rn0P4BFVQMsGw.text: This was a GREAT PLACE to eat, fun  friendly and very entertaining with out tv, the city and food was really good. Everyone should try this place at least once for fun.

fSu1ZteWHf4kj-_P7X47lw.text: Every 4th of July you'll find us here, it has become a tradition that we plan to continue for a long time. Watching the fireworks going off all over the city with a glass of wine and a good meal is a pretty wonderful experience. July 4th aside though, the Compass is a bit overpriced, the food is always good, but not quite as amazing as the price would make you think. You're really paying for an incredible (seriously incredible) view and a very romantic atmosphere. The menu changes frequently, so it's hard to make recommendations, but if the lobster bisque is available, get it. With consistently good service, three star food, an incredible wine list and a view that can't be beat, four stars seems totally fair to me. I can't think of a more romantic restaurant in the Valley, and even though it's a little overpriced it's still a place we love to go to make memories.

NaD7MyAk0UjuNCNyv_IDYQ.text: My fiance took me for my birthday on 3.8.17. It was both of our first time at this restaurant. Our reservation was for 6:30pm I wanted to make sure we would be there in time for the sunset which did not disappoint! The view is great and even better when it is dark out and you can see the twinkling lights from the cars below.   Our waitress, Jerry, was very sweet! Extremely helpful, talkative and great service overall. We had help from another gentleman who would occasionally pass by and fill our water glass. Let me tell you our water glass was never empty it was his mission to fill them!   The food was good. It took around 30-45 minutes to get our food after we ordered it. It was a busy night but there were tables open. Luckily we ordered an appetizer that kept us going until our food arrived.  Our food was good. I ordered the Steak Medallion which came out very rare and I had asked for medium/well but there was no way I was going to wait another 30 minutes for my food if I sent it back so I ate it without complaint. My fiance ordered the chicken sandwich and blue cheese mac & cheese. We aren't a fan of blue cheese but it wasn't actually bad.  We spent 2 hours there and the only reason we know that is because we went in two full circles (at 55 minutes a complete 360 degrees)   *************PARKING *********************** Downtown Phoenix can be tricky with its "one way" only, narrow streets. It can cause some anxiety if you are not used to it. We didn't really know what we were doing with parking so we parked in the Chase Tower parking garage which is north of the Hyatt. 2 hours came out to $12. However, if you park in the Regency Parking garage which is just south of the Hyatt the restaurant can validate 2 hours of parking where as they cannot do that for the Chase Tower Parking Garage.

kU62f_xkfRSrnCfUJoUPDA.text: Went with my husband for our first year wedding anniversary. We were very much looking forward to the dinner and he made it a point to mention that it was a special anniversary dinner when we made the reservation. When we were seated the server asked if we were "celebrating any special occasion?" and I excitedly mentioned the anniversary. The red sangria was good but the food was sub par. We were slightly disappointed that they didn't bring out any celebratory champagne or dessert. Usually nicer restaurants make it a point to celebrate with you.  The view was nice, The server was kind, but I would't recommend to any friends.  We ended up having drinks and dessert elsewhere and had a lovely evening after dinner.  P.S.  We had a 7:15 dinner and it was pretty slow for a Saturday night. Maybe other people are catching on that its only perk is the view?

-XrFGdfqr0p7_tJJWKEK1Q.text: My boyfriend and I went to dinner the week of Valentine's day and made a reservation two days in advance. The restaurant definitely delivered with its beautiful scenery and a good ambiance and all though they messed up my boyfriend's meal, they quickly fixed it and were very kind about it. We absolutely loved it here and can't wait to come back in the future!

9YeK_YUedcccW7PuY5DHlA.text: First time here for our anniversary. It was amazing!! The rotating views were constantly changing and great! Service was very attentive. But the food was crazy good...the filet mignon was so tender and flavorful. We will definitely be back:-)

B_0cpJ7qg2AiJs0jMhlyIg.text: Exceptional experience at The Compass!  I made reservations here for my boyfriend's 24th birthday. We were greeted with warm smiles as soon as we met the hostess. Our server was amazing! She was super accommodating and provided great suggestions when asked. I only wished I had remember her name to give her recognition, however the entire staff that helped us were wonderful. I had the salmon while my boyfriend had the pork chops. Both in which were cooked to perfection. The spectacular rotating view of Phoenix was just an added bonus ;) Our server also gave my boyfriend and I complimentary desserts in celebration of his birthday, which was very appreciated.

6vq5xbNSKVC6sE5k5NuRjQ.text: Great food, excellent service and beautiful view. My wife Diana and I celebrated our 20th Anniversary and we loved everything about this experience. We highly recommend Compass Arizona Grill.       :)

IIE1H3DjKlM94oZGucECuQ.text: My wife and I went there to celebrate our 33rd wedding anniversary. Very nice atmosphere and great place for special occasions. Really nice that you get to see all views of Downtown Phoenix and other parts of the valley as the restaurant rotates while yout eating dinner. Food is really flavorful and delicious. If you like greens I highly recommend their greens with pork belly. They were very spicy and full of flavor. Service was great too!

yR6c_9EyZc9EQekf2SZ9uw.text: Came for my 23rd birthday, I love this place. I would recommend the Compass to everyone. It is fine dinning so obviously prices are going to be a little high plus your paying to a beautiful view so idk why people complained about it being too expensive. Love love this place food was delicious!! Amazing staff

2iL-uJm_O-fIoklpmDDIVA.text: Our dinner reservation was for 6pm. We showed up at 5:30pm to see if we could be seated early. The hostess stated "We will seat you at 6pm". I asked if we could order an alcoholic beverage from the bar, she stated No, If you want a drink you need go back to the first floor & order something from the restaurant. So back down we went. We bought 2 drinks (Bloody Mary & vodkas tonic) our price was $23. We had to wait in line to get back on the elevator. We arrived promptly at 6pm. I again checked in with the hostess station. We were not seated until 6:18pm. There was zero explanation as to why we were seated so late and there were many other couples waiting to be seated for 6pm. The hostesses write your name on a small sticky note and they line them up and seat you by that. Finally, we were seated with many open tables and they were not busy.  Couldn't figure out what the delay was? We had 7:30pm ballet tickets at the Convention center and I knew we'd be late. The view from the restaurant was impeccable & the waitress provided top notch service. We mentioned to her we would be late due to being seated late, I couldn't finish my entree (due to time) so we had to pay and leave quickly to make it before curtain. The food was excellent but we felt rushed. Wished we could have stayed longer. When we left, there were around 10 couples waiting to be seated. The manager gave us a huge credit to our bill. We were very grateful. The hostesses need to figure out the seating situation - once you get seated the other staff takes over and provides excellent service!!! I would go back - but not on a night in which I had another event to attend.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9jS3ZxDtAizEKEGrgREggw.text: Romantic with astonashing views of the city from a top of the Hyatt.  Food is top notch and a generous wine list.   What we ordered:  Flat Iron Steak Rissotto Cake Robert Mondavi Pinot Noir Creme Brule Trio  Our server was attentive and on point. Didn't get her name, but kudos for the service.  Note: the floor rotates and you'll able to have a 360 view of PHX. So, if you easily get deasy, consider this option twice.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creme brule trio
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GGsSonCVSJh-qtmNQ8KAhA.text: I had a horrible experience. I came here August 2nd for a friends birthday. First we sit down and the girl is all angry and obviously didn't seem to want to serve us so then she disappears for like 15 min, we have no water or anything so then finally a guy comes along and says she went home but she didn't we saw her the whole night. So obviously In frustrated at this point. No one said happy birthday, there was no dessert, the waiter kept squint stay hydrated and was just arrogant. It was pretty unfortunate because I usually come here frequently and I was with people who just came here so I was trying to show them a good and nice time.

ssbnVeyDmOMf1Byu8AMRUg.text: The view and everything is very nice, as well as the ambience, food was excellent, but my girlfriend woke up at 4AM with horrible food poisoning. We split the calamari, and she had the grilled chicken sandwich, which I even took a few bites of but did not get sick. Be careful of what you order.

iFFmc5qjxZc6GVgai7hBGw.text: The food was awesome.  The ambiance was great. The setting was romantic.  The service left much to be desired.   I made a reservation 24 hours prior to arriving with my date.  At time of reservation I let the restaurant know it was Heather's birthday and I asked if they could set the table with flowers.  At the time I was told it was no problem.  On the way to dinner, traffic was heavy so I called to inform the restaurant we'd be a few minutes behind.  I was told it was no problem and our table would still be there for us.  It was at that time I was told that they wouldn't be able to do flowers as they need to be purchased ahead of time.  (This could have been communicated to me when making the reservation).     We arrived 5 minutes after our reserved time and checked in.  We then waited 10 minutes or so before being seated (assuming our table had been given to others or not prepared yet).  Once seated we were in a section with several empty tables which left us confused as to why we waited in the lobby for these tables?   (I'd rather wait at an empty table with a view than the small lobby by the elevators, especially near sunset).     Upon checking in the hostess asked if there was a special occasion.   I told her it was Heather's birthday... which was actually written on the reservation card that I could see on the desk.  Someone else seated us and asked if it was a special occasion, I told her it was Heather's birthday.    Our first server came up to fill our waters and asked if it was a special occasion, and I told them it was Heather's birthday.  And finally our server arrived and asked if it was a special occasion... I again, for the fourth time told him it was Heather's birthday.   I don't recall any of those four to acknowledge it and wish Heather a Happy Birthday.  Our server came by twice before I asked him if we could order our drinks.   It felt like it took 10 minutes for the drinks to arrive and as the waiter was leaving I asked if we could order.  All employees were pleasant enough, but none seemed to know what was going on.  It felt as if all were on their first week on the job and first time in the service industry.  Food was great, atmosphere was awesome, views were amazing.  Service could  use some coaching and development.

EltvHuQo5S79WB4vUKAlig.text: Amazing beautiful place everyone should definitely come here for peaceful very romantic place these yelp pictures don't do justice I promise you me and my husband spent our anniversary here today and everything from the 360 view of sunset to the waitress was so pleasant love love love this place me and my husband will be here again!!!

Al5L2LPcwPKD3DsnacpZ9g.text: We were downtown to see Bon Jovi and to celebrate my wife's birthday.  Seeing the sunset with 360 views made an awesome night even better.  The staff was warm and inviting.  Our waiter Jacob was professional and on point.  The salmon and beef medallions were on point though you are paying more for the experience.  Dessert of the bread pudding was the only negative as it was over cooked, meaning burnt inside.  Jacob took care of us right away and so glad we came.  Thanks for helping us make new memories!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CpzSJe8DjCXgv3OkOx5r_A.text: Our family, a group of 8 had Christmas Eve dinner at Compass. The setting was beautiful and our reservation time was honored. The reason for only issuing 2 starts: our wait staff belonged in a much less expensive eatery, took drink order, came back 15 min later and took appetizers order, still no drinks. Drinks and appetizers came out but we still had not ordered dinner and had to eat our appetizers with the large bulky menu in our laps. Lobster bisque was good. Salads were very small. I ordered the Brie fondue and it was good except the pomegranates were bad, FERMENTED. Dinner was ok nothing great!  Not worth the $500 tab!

AKW7RgUElNolJDXNjNKlcQ.text: Horribly shockingly overpriced. Decided against dinner after reading reviews, looking at the menu and settled on drinks and desert. 3 drinks and a $10 desert was $60 bill, parking was $15. I will never bother to go back.

aJXjL_ycqxbnT0x7ZFmJIQ.text: The view was the best thing, the food was nothing to be excited for and nothing to rave about. i will not return. We came for our Anniversary dinner and were very disappointed

NlyQ5Cit6JGRkb_kL8bKuQ.text: My wife and I have been trying to get a reservation here for 3 years for Valentine's Day and were finally able to this year.  We arrived early & enjoyed a nice drink down in the lobby bar before taking the fast elevator up to the Restaurant.  We were still early, but they were able to get us right in and immediately the ambiance of the Restaurant and the view of the city were amazing.  They gave my wife a long stem rose and wished us both Happy Valentine's day which we both thought was very cool.  Our Waitress and her assistant were both very good and our drinks stayed full the entire meal.  The Food was amazing.  It's not food we have each day, so it was certainly a treat for us.  They even had 2 little surprises during the meal from the chef that was over and beyond what was expected.  Even though it was a holiday, our meal was never rushed.  Having the Restaurant revolve and being able to see the entire city during sunset made the meal & the experience even better.  Overall the food, ambiance, experience and service was outstanding and we will certainly be going back again soon.

-JZMGoF0E3NdKrOYpyYnmw.text: My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday. He was taking me to the Chris Rock show so he made sure to find a restaurant close to the venue.  The Compass Grill is located in the Hyatt hotel. We got to the hotel and saw so many high school students. It was their Prom night. Brought back so many old memories. There is a elevator that takes you to the 24th Floor where the restaurant is located. We got there and was greeted by the hostess who saw that my boyfriend requested a seat by a window. She told us it would be about a 10- 15 minute wait since those tables are first come first serve. About ten minutes later she walks us to a beautiful table right next to the window. We went at a perfect time because we got to see the sunset. A older woman came by and filled up our water glasses, she was so pleasant and friendly. Our waiter  was precise and wonderful. We both had the mole chicken with mashed potatoes and mole sauce on the side. We also shared the crab cakes which was definitely our favorite! As for drinks I had a American Mule and my boyfriend had a mojito. The icing on the cake was they gave me a complimentary birthday dessert which was delicious!   The restaurant itself revolves and it takes an hour to do a full circle. It is definitely a fun experience to check out on special occasions or if you're from out of town. We do wish there were more food options, but overall it was a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The beautiful and tasty birthday dessert.
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HlBS4rXNP_F8uXzgd8_zCg.text: We reserved dinner for 6pm which was perfect, we wanted to enjoy the AZ sunset.  It was dinner with business owners so they witnessed our amazing skyline.  The cocktails were delicious.  The service was fantastic. We each ordered something different, each dish was prepared wonderfully.    This is a great spot to either enjoy drinks or dinner.  The rotating view heading into the evening is the perfect touch for any occasion.

-JDcn5en23zMqlRvB1lf_w.text: This restaurant is nearly impossible to get to if you're staying in the hotel. First off, it's only accessible through the glass elevators. It was hard enough getting into those because only the other elevators were coming to our floor every time we pushed the up button. After 15 mins of waiting for the right elevator, we got to the 24th floor only to find a waiting room area full of people and a long line. It was completely disorganized. The hostess wasn't doing her job by taking names. Everyone just stood in the line. Some lady came out of the elevator, went to the front of the line, gave the hostess her name, and was put way ahead of all of us waiting. Finally my husband went up after 20 mins of standing in line and asked why it's taking so long to just put our name in. She finally got a clue and took everyone's names.  When we were finally seated the hostess asked if we'd like anything to drink. We asked for 2 coffees with cream and sugar. We were brought the coffee and sugar but no cream. The waiter came and we asked him for the cream, which never came. 10 mins later my husband got up and went toward the kitchen to find the waiter and ask him again for cream. We finally got it but by this time my coffee was lukewarm at best. Now for the order. I ordered the chilaquiles with no pico de gallo. When I got it, it had the pico all over it. I sent it back, was given a new one but now with no red sauce and the pico on the side. I was so annoyed at this point that I took a bite and it was terrible. We ended up asking for the bill and left. The waiter and manager were apologetic and comped the meals we didn't eat but this experience was horrible. The view isn't worth the trouble.

QlqL8-lAPyfauMMuSYPO5Q.text: Worth every penny, had an awesome server by the name of Julian, very hospitable and shadowed a great attention to the little things that make dining out entertaining.  We booked our reservation online at 5pm for a 6pm table and that went incredibly smooth.  The food was fantastic and the views were amazing, especially around sunset. A definite must for any traveller!!!

MCFgQ5C7-ieuJq1pxqpUVA.text: Christy...thank you for having a wonderful smile and great service. I just ordered a drink. Nothing on the menu but our waitress was very pleasant. Great atmosphere for a date. Will have to taste the food next time and update my review.

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-v2_Bz1M-n8xzPpnhqYXZA.text: Came here for my birthday dinner. Service was great food was amazing and the view was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Compass Arizona Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hhpbZbIZcy93rrxhksSoLg.text: Compass is at the top of Hyatt Regency, where I was staying for a work trip.  I came here for breakfast, and it was slow.  The restaurant wraps around the entire top floor of the hotel, and has a beautiful view.  The restaurant is very aesthetically pleasing, but I was disappointed there is no bar where you can sit.  Server was friendly, but fairly inattentive.  I get that a lot of places when I go in "off hours".   I got an omelet and a Bloody Mary.  Both were fair.  This was more of a 3-star experience, but I'm giving it 4 because of the ambience/view, and the server being friendly.  I would give it one more chance, but would probably go for dinner.  I do highly recommend they consider adding a bar, as many people staying in the hotel at any given time are traveling alone, and many (like me) hate sitting at a table alone.

5z_zatbyqoYgMd84w6ucYA.text: Well like I said 1 star .. so we made a reservation for dinner on Saturday night and well all bad .  1. Vegan menu for my wife was only like 2 items   2. Service was sh$& and so we decided just to leave if it was starting off like this I wasn't going to stay and deal with the rest of the BS .   3. Restroom where closed and as we where walking out I let the host know how bad the servicer was and then she said that they where closeting the restaurant for the night . I guess that's her excuse for bing rude .

FT7keNwEoDGd0mB2U7WIWw.text: Amazing environment and setting! Great views and impeccable service as well. I would return- however the price is a little steep for the quality of food- in my opinion. I went for a birthday, and comfortably spent 100$ a head for 6 people including drinks and gratuity. I recommend you check menu ahead of time and arrive early to your reservation. Prepare to take out your wallets, and enjoy a good evening at the Compass Grill!

g4bkA8a_sRx17kjWe7CTJA.text: Very nice place, particularly to celebrate a special occasion. We stopped here for appetizers, drinks, and dessert. We do not routinely visit places downtown but we liked this restaurant very much and will probably be back.  If you make reservations make sure to request a table by the window so you get to enjoy the view. We were facing West during sunset time and it was definitely a stunning view. I think our server's name was Karla and she was outstanding. The brie fondue was really good, and so were the cocktails and desserts.

S40AyGkpN-5rRt5t-1hv7Q.text: We stayed in the hotel and came here for the view to end the night.  We had cheese board, wine & dessert.   Great place to hang out and enjoy the city  lights.

-BhRtbYtziY-TX_shGia6g.text: This place was incredible, great service and beautiful view of course. Only thing I had an issue was when I asked the server (Julian) for dessert first he clearly told me that they didn't serve desert. When we were for finished with our food, they offered us the desert menu. Like seriously that's annoying.

TP2vROt6GdiCbZpZiNNVGw.text: The food is expensive but definitely delicious, so it's totally worth it! I am extremely afraid of heights but this location and the entire atmosphere was beautiful! Despite revolving slowly at several thousands of feet in the air, I truly enjoyed my experience here. From the appetizers to the entree and the dessert, all phenomenal. I Would definitely recommend for special occasions.
